review:
Este juego es lo que parece a primera vista: un clon de Age of Empires 2 con gr√°ficos low-poly, sin campa√±a, con 7 facciones asim√©tricas (a diferencia de las 70 cl√≥nicas del juego original) y lo m√°s importante: con un modelo de juego como servicio F2P. Le doy nota positiva por esto solamente, porque ya merece la pena aunque sea probarlo al ser gratis. Eso s√≠, ya aviso que s√≥lo hay una civilizaci√≥n desbloqueada y para jugar con las dem√°s se tienen que comprar aparte, hasta un precio de 30‚Ç¨ (AoE 1-3 cuestan 20‚Ç¨ y el AoE4 cuesta 40‚Ç¨).

A no ser que busqu√©is un juego competitivo que, valga la redundancia, sea competencia de AoE2, casi que es mejor pagar por el original, en mi opini√≥n. Adem√°s, el AoE3 es tambi√©n F2P en unas condiciones que considero mejores que estas, por lo que, si bien Empires Apart no es una mala oferta, palidece en comparaci√≥n con el producto de marca original.

review:
A lowpoly & lowbudget copy of Age of Empire, nothing as innovative as anticipated in the introduction.
Unnecessarily complex interface and mechanics, several lighting problems during sunrise and sunset and too low visibility at night.
The only good thing is that compared to AoE it is free, for everything else it is weak.

review:
Empires Apart, strategy, tarih ve mitoloji unsurlarƒ±nƒ± bir araya getiren bir ger√ßek zamanlƒ± strateji oyunudur. Oyuncular, bir√ßok farklƒ± uygarlƒ±k arasƒ±ndan se√ßim yaparak kendi imparatorluklarƒ±nƒ± kurabilir ve geli≈ütirebilirler.

Oyunda, oyuncular, kaynaklarƒ± toplamak, binalar in≈üa etmek, askerler eƒüitmek ve sava≈ü taktikleri geli≈ütirmek gibi bir√ßok farklƒ± g√∂revi yerine getirirler. Oyuncular, ordularƒ±nƒ± y√∂neterek diƒüer oyunculara veya yapay zekaya kar≈üƒ± sava≈üabilirler.

Empires Apart, oynanabilirlik a√ßƒ±sƒ±ndan olduk√ßa ba≈üarƒ±lƒ±dƒ±r. Oyun, g√ºzel bir grafik tasarƒ±mƒ±na ve etkileyici bir m√ºzikal skora sahiptir. Oyuncular, farklƒ± uygarlƒ±klarƒ±n benzersiz √∂zelliklerini ke≈üfederek ve kendi stratejilerini geli≈ütirerek zorlu g√∂revlerle kar≈üƒ±la≈üƒ±rlar.

Oyunun en √∂nemli √∂zelliklerinden biri, farklƒ± uygarlƒ±klarƒ±n birbirinden farklƒ± yeteneklerine sahip olmasƒ±dƒ±r. √ñrneƒüin, Moƒüollar atlƒ± sava≈ü√ßƒ±larƒ± kullanƒ±rken, Koreliler top√ßu birimleriyle √ºnl√ºd√ºr. Bu √∂zellik, oyunculara farklƒ± oyun tarzlarƒ± deneme fƒ±rsatƒ± sunar.

Sonu√ß olarak, Empires Apart, ger√ßek zamanlƒ± strateji oyunlarƒ±na ilgi duyan oyuncular i√ßin harika bir se√ßenek. review: Bottom line, it's a great game for what it is. Free version is just fine to play with the kids to give them an intro into RTS games. Simple enough UI for my 6 year old to play; and she builds impressive sized armies and sprawling towns - she needs to work on her strategy, but she gets better each game. Complex enough to enjoy with experienced players.

author: {'steamid': '76561199194731012', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1641086866}
review:
[h1] Jogo bom, nos primeiros 30 minutos [/h1]
Achei o jogo perdido na minha galeria e resolvi fazer uma an√°lise. 
Vou tentar ser o mais sucinto poss√≠vel e cobrir os seguintes t√≥picos na review:
[list]
    [*]Jogabilidade
    [*]Gr√°ficos & sons
    [*]Microtransa√ß√µes
[/list]
(No final tem um resumo caso n√£o queira ler tudo)
[h2]Jogabilidade[/h2]
Jogabilidade que se espera de um RTS normal (d√° para fazer tudo usando praticamente s√≥ o mouse, mas, se quiser, pode usar as binds do teclado para facilitar as coisas). Voc√™ d√° tarefas pros seus personagens, e eles as cumprem, simples. O jogo tamb√©m tem um tutorial, que te ensina o b√°sico, isto √©, o a fun√ß√£o de cada bichinho, apesar de que, se voc√™ j√° tiver experi√™ncia com algum outro jogo do g√™nero, n√£o vai perder tempo pulando-o. O principal inc√¥modo √© o fato de voc√™ ser incapaz de treinar scouts (os quais servem para adquirir informa√ß√µes pelo mapa), assim, se seu √∫nico scout morrer, j√° era. Al√©m disso tudo, o pathfinding √© meio bugado.
[h2]Gr√°ficos & sons[/h2]
N√£o tem muito o que dizer aqui, os gr√°ficos s√£o exatamente o que √© mostrado no an√∫ncio do game, e os efeitos sonoros s√£o bons, a m√∫sica √© boa, por√©m repetitiva.
[h2]Microtransa√ß√µes[/h2]
As microtransa√ß√µes constituem um dos principais fatores que matam o tempo de vida do game, e desmotiva o crescimento da playerbase, porque para se ter a experi√™ncia completa do jogo, voc√™ precisa obter os packs de DLC, que s√£o ridiculamente caros - 10 reais (DEIZ√ÉO) para desbloquear uma civiliza√ß√£o nova, al√©m das lootbox oferecidas. Caso n√£o queira comprar, voc√™ pode se contentar com sua civiliza√ß√£o default, que n√£o √© l√° aquelas coisas. Sinceramente, era melhor venderem o jogo do que fazerem esse F2P feio. Ah, pelo que eu vi, o multiplayer ta morto, n√£o consegui achar nenhum lobby em 5-8 minutos de busca.
[h1]Conclus√£o[/h1]
O jogo tinha potencial: gr√°ficos bons, trilha sonora mediana e uma jogabilidade nada mal, MAS as microtransa√ß√µes acabam com sua vontade de jogar. Minha maior divers√£o foi o tutorial.

review: i soliti problemi tipici di questi rts online: a parte che vabb√® il gioco √® misconosciuto ed √® difficile trovare altri giocatori, specialmente per le partite non classificate: non sono riuscito a farne UNA. Ma il vero problema √® un altro: giocatori che non rispondono in chat a nessuna lingua, e quando perdono mi esce il messaggio "migrazione dell'host in corso", aspetti 3 minuti come un fesso poi "il giocatore ha abbandonato la partita" e continua a caricare all'infinito; non √® che abbia esattamente il tempo da perdere a guardare una schermata di caricamento vuota dopo che un giocatore infantile ha ragequittato e copato facendo drop trick. Si perch√® immagino sia stato il famigerato "drop trick" di aoe3, possibile che ancora non sono riusciti a trovare una soluzione? Ma bannateli sti giocatori squallidi che fanno coping con il drop trick, ho capito che sono pochi i giocatori totali ma a cosa serve averceli? Se volevo tossicit√† e infantilismo scaricavo LoL. Edit: ah ma ho dimenticato la cosa pi√π grave, √® ottimizzato a livelli che √® meglio non commentare, per non violare le regole di Steam. Dico solo che sullo stesso PC Frostpunk gira meglio, non serve aggiungere altro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105941860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1645926175}
review:
Decent RTS.

+ f2p
+ good for f2- graphics
+ wasn't very laggy

- all but one starting race is paywalled
- starting a bot game is unpleasant. Changing settings requires you to go through a defeat screen, which is mildly insulting if you picked the wrong map
- still kinda laggy
- too many pop-ups, notifications, and alerts

It's a decent but fairly generic rts, and the tutorial seems to think you've never played an rts before. You can't turn off alerts for simple things. The tutorial is unnecessary, but every time I logged it, it tried to make me take the tutorial again.

The game is on a day/night cycle that's annoying, and I didn't see a way to turn it off. The problem was during night the game was too dark to play and during day the gamma was overloaded.

It's not bad for what it is, but there are just so many better rts games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372596040', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1643659066}
review:
Me esperaba mas de este juego pero empezare por los puntos positivos

Puntos positivos:
1- El apartado grafico es unico en los rts ya que nunca antes encontre uno como este
2- Es algo rapido
3- Para jugar con amigos esta bien para un par de partidas

Puntos Negativos:
1-Cuenta con 7 civilizaciones cuales para mi gusto se queda algo corto
2- Si vas a jugar por lo de "gratis" solo podras usar una civilizacion (bizantinos) el resto son todas de pago
3- Algunos granjeros por su IA deciden dejar de trabajar
4- Si buscas un modo historia como en el AoE... Mejor vuelve al AoE, este no tiene
5- Cuenta con 2 modos que se suele usar que seria 1v1 o con amigos
6- No cuenta con algo que te diga que es lo especial de ciertas civilizaciones no como otros rts

En conclusion, el juego esta bien si no tienes otra  cosa que hacer como esperar a una descarga o esperar 20 minutos por que hayas quedado o algo pero si buscas algo mas profundo... Aqui no vas a encontrarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198144192863', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1641947548}
review:
this game is alright. the biggest downside i think is that all but one empire is locked behind a paywall, which in and of itself is passable as it is a free to play game. there are lootboxes but as far as i can tell its all cosmetics. it is heavily focused on multiplayer, and as such there is no campaign and very little for a solo player to do other than just AI skirmishes. as for PvP, i havent managed to get into a game due to the low player count.
otherwise everything else you want in a civilization RTS is there. the AI is a little funky, but its not useless. resources and basebuilding heavily resemble age of empires and it functions well. to top if off, it has achievements, but many are unobtainable without DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108144738', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1609284734}
review:
Nato sostanzialmente come un plagio in chiave moderna di Age of Empires, questo gioco riesce ad essere convincente eccetto un problema piuttosto fastidioso. 

Il comparto tecnico √® anni luce davanti a quello di AoE, con uno stile low poly moderno e piacevole e dettagli ben realizzati.

Il gameplay invece √® una pura imitazione, con qualche semplificazione nelle costruzioni e nelle meccaniche pi√π profonde, e concretamente non √® originale in niente.

Un piccolo difetto √® lo scarso numero di civilt√† presenti, di cui solo una sbloccata all'inizio, e senza grosse variazioni tra esse, se non nell'aspetto. Carina per√≤ la possibilit√† di personalizzare le singole unit√† delle civilt√†, in modo da renderle riconoscibili e premiare anche le ore di gioco.

Il pi√π grande difetto per√≤ √® che quando sono presenti nella mappa molte unit√†, le risorse richieste al PC sono esorbitanti e inizia a laggare pesantemente (√® successo anche agli amici con cui ho giocato).

In conclusione, per essere free to play √® davvero ben fatto, mi spiace che non sia molto conosciuto (√® anche italiano) perch√© potrebbe essere una valida alternativa ai titoli pi√π blasonati, soprattutto nei gruppi di amici in cui bisogna trovare un gioco comune a tutti.

VOTO: 7+/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970498494', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1712282589}
review:
Old school RTS, in other words you gather resources, build buildings, produce units, advance economic and military techs.  

There are seven factions:  Byzantines, French, Arabs, Mongols, Chinese, Koreans, Aztecs.  Any RTS that has the Byzantines gets a bonus from me, I always love playing them.  Definitely leans toward Asia; five of the seven civilizations are rooted in Asia (if you include the Byzantines and the Arabs).  I'm not sure why, as this game was developed in Italy.  Each civilization has unique architecture; one of my pet peeves in RTS games is recycled architecture and units,  The units are unique as well, at least in appearance.

There is a skirmish mode and you can adjust the difficulty of the AI.  There is no campaign mode, but that has never been a deal breaker for me.  

The soundtrack is very stirring, orchestral.  

Graphics are really low poly, and some of the trees look really weird, but it does not detract from game play. You cannot rotate camera, and that always bugs me.  You can't rotate buildings either.  

I think the coolest thing about the game is that you can to some extent customize your civilization.  You have to buy some of the custom models in the form of "chests" with mystery contents.  You get different banners, buildings, weapons, hats, and shields.  

I give the game 8/10.  I wish the trees looked less geometric, and I wish you could rotate the camera,  I wish there were more factions; I'd love to see Russia, Germany, Ottomans and maybe an African civ.  If you are a real RTS fan like me, this one is definitely worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202080828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1636044540}
review:
Questo non √® un free-to-play con DLC a pagamento che espandono, ma una DEMO dove puoi acquistare i DLC per ottenere il gioco completo!

Ci sono molti elementi del gioco (parte dei men√π, achievement, tasti di scelta rapida, messaggi degli eventi, alcuni tooltip, il secondo tutorial...) che sono rimasti in inglese... non sapevo fosse questo [b]l'idioma di Ravenna[/b]. Inoltre, "Fortificato" per "in presidio" √® una traduzione parecchio strana, soprattutto per le reliquie.
Elemento curioso del gioco, che per√≤ complica un po', √® che i nomi di unit√†, costruzioni ed eroi sono nella propria lingua.
Nascosto nella cartella di istallazione c'√® una cartella Manuals che per√≤ contiene pubblicit√†, e per di pi√π in inglese!

La IA "Normale" √® gi√† troppo aggressiva, impostandola pi√π semplice invece a volte diventa fin troppo facile, manca la giusta via di mezzo.

I tutorial sono poco esaustivi e se hai gi√† giocato ad AoE o simili hai una vaga idea di come dovrebbe funzionare il gioco e ti scontrerai con 1000 differenze sull'idea che ti sei fatto di come dovrebbe funzionare queso genere, altrimeni non sai da che parte cominciare.
[list]
[*]Non tutti i tasti di scelta rapida possono essere personalizzati... la virgola per selezionare gli abitanti? Non √® possibile selezionare le unit√† militari in attesa.
[*]Capire quali tecnologie sono disponibili da quali no √® difficile perch√® sono due tonalit√† di grigio al posto che a colori. Le tecnologie in sviluppo hanno la stessa tonalit√† di quelle non sviluppabili. Qui l'unico vincolo allo sviluppo di tecnologie √® la disponibilit√† di risorse, altrimenti non sono proprio visualizzate.
[*]L'unico modo per mettere in pausa √® aprire il men√π, e se sei in giocatore singolo, nelle prime partite, magari vorresti mettere in pausa mentre quardi l'albero delle tenologie, e mentre √® aperto c'√® pure il concreto rischio di dare ordini alle unit√† in partita. Inoltre in trasarenza la partita sembra andare avanti anche mentre √® in pausa, probabilmente non √® cos√¨, ma √® poco piacevole.
[*]Molti men√π sono poco intuitivi.
[*]Alcune unit√† e costruzioni hanno comportamento "strano" e differente da una partita all'altra. Alcune unit√† spariscono senza lasciare traccia e se sono state uccise proprio non me ne sono accorto.
[*]Gli eroi, oltre a non poter essere scelti (come invece avveniva in EE) una volta morti paiono non poter essere riaddestrabili (non che abbia chiss√† che importanza). Stesso discorso per l'esploratore.
[*]Posso costruire un edificio chiamato "Bandiera" perfettamente inutile pur senza essere una Meraviglia.
[*]Alcune unit√† non mostrano la quantit√† di risorsa trasportata.
[*]Non √® possibile chiedere risorse a un alleato, ma solo inviarne... non che ne abbiano mai chieste.
[*]La gestione della navi √® "complicata".
[*]√à disponibile un selezionatore automatico delle unit√† danneggiate ma non per le costruzioni.
[/list]

Ho provato questo gioco perch√® cercavo un RTS alternativo ad AoE ma per fortuna il panorama degli RTS open source √® vasto.
Il risultato di questo titolo √® un po' la copia venuta male di AoE2, condito con la caotica gestione delle unit√† di Empire Earth e alcuni nomi presi direttamente da RoN! E i DLC di Crusader Kings 2.
√à poco tattico: in attacco soprattutto l'unica √® produrre quante pi√π unit√† possibile e mandarle quasi al massacro.
Va bene che sono sfide, ma dovrebbe essere possibile superarle! E poi, terminata una sfida, magari voglio tornare al men√π.
Sono assenti cose come trucchi, possibilit√† di mod, campagne ed editor.

Leggendo alcune recensioni, pare che questo gioco sia pensato pi√π per il multiplayer che per il giocatore singolo. Di norma, prima si impara a giocare contro il computer e poi si prova contro altri giocatori!

Apprezzabile l'auto ricostruzione delle fattorie (per quel poco che producono), pietra e oro che cambiano aspetto man mano che vengono raccolte (contrariamente alle costruzioni), il selettore automatico delle unit√† ferite (se solo fosse possibile curarle tutte), anche le reliquie che hanno effetti diversi in base alla quantit√† (sebbene, AoM era pi√π dinamico).

Ci sarebbero numerose altre cose che potrebbero essere migliorate in questo gioco, ma le condivider√≤ con gli sviluppatori se avranno voglia di starmi a sentire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057600993', 'num_games_owned': 3252, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1635623236}
review:
Pros:
+ Low poly yet detailed art style	
+ Fitting soundtrack
+ Day/night cycle and weather effects; these are simple but a nice addition

Cons:
- No campaign
- Town Center and Villager UI icons in the tutorial bugged out; they all turned into white squares
- Doesn't show a line when queuing actions
- Can't try out other civilizations unless you pay for them; a trial option would be good here
- The fps slider would only let me set to at 59 or 61 but not 60; I had to use vsync to force it
- Can't pause in the tutorial despite it being single-player
- Weird animation lag on units?
- No way to adjust game speed?
- The population cap alert is visual, not audible
- Battles don't feel satisfying

This would have been better as (regular) priced game with a campaign instead of what it is now. Being a priced game means it probably would have been more polished too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056806314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1635509642}
review:
Nice game. But needs some improvements. Some basic features are missing. Because of that i stopped playing.

What should be in game;

- Unlimited production queue:
6 at total is nothing and i dont want to look at buildings constantly to make sure they are producing.
- Usefull shortcuts:
Select all infantry. Select all Horsemans. Select all siege units. For workers, get back to you work (esp after building construction)
-Easy Construction Orders:
Being able to give construction orders without selecting the worker.
-Copy the building option:
I should able to copy the building while selecting one. Selecting a wall and simply click a button and start building it waaay more easier than select worker than build it. and way more faster.
-ZOOM
This game is way to zoomed in...

Overall, i would like to keep play this game. It has potential. I am sure there are many players doesnt keep playing it cuz of this QoL features are missing.. Hope developers can see this. And update the game. But as a F2P game. Still better than most games on steam. 

pls developers. QoL man....

author: {'steamid': '76561198116978327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 31394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11800, 'last_played': 1704326580}
review:
The short of it:

This is an abandoned game, but it is complete enough to be a hoot. It's better than all of its contemporaries, including Age of Empires, and, in spite of hating RTS games as a whole, I still think this game is worth playing, the only RTS I'd recommend. The music is great too. 




The long of it:

First of all, I hate RTS games. I think the most common traits about them are what make them hostile to casual players and ultimately unfun in the long run. RTSs as we understand them are irredeemable. 



That said, if I HAD to pick one, it'd be this one. It has so much charm, so much room for fooling around, the quality of everything is top-notch and it is the coolest RTS there is right now, even ahead of others like AoE2 or War Selection.

It has almost no documentation but in a way that serves as both a negative and a positive because it leads you to discover things yourself instead of just googling what the "correct" build order is. (sadly, because this is an RTS, it does have a correct way to play.)

The closest alternative to this game is Age of Empires 2 which doesn't compare. That one is a bunch of rehashing and reskinning with minor stat tweaks and a thousand expansions they want you to buy even though you already bought the game. Where as in Empires Apart, every civilization is well designed, fleshed-out, compelling and fun as hell. 

The Mongols here are EXACTLY how they are supposed to be. AoE2 dropped the ball on those. 

Although you have to earn the other civs through lootboxes, Byzantium is still fun on its own and it grows on you the more you use it. As a screw-around game, I think this beats all of its contemporaries. 

I could go on and on but the game is free so I encourage you to explore it yourself. Skirmish mode allows you to play at exactly the difficulty you're in the mood for, so no pressure. By the way, the music is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093812035', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1632714203}
review:
Great little game, I just found out recently. Good game for a couple of skirmishes with AI, this game also controls well and units work very well. In the base F2P version you cna play as Byzantines, then rest civs you need to buy as DLC. This game also has cosmetic MTX, but they are not worth a dime and I don't waste money on them.

The civs are pretty well done, every civ has unique mechanics, and they all play very nicely. I purchased French, China and Mongols and they all play very differently.

This is a more of an evolution of AOE 2, with base mechanics intact, if you don't wanna play AOE 2 in 3D, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056315687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1618607362}
review:
This game had a lot of potential, but devs for no given reason just abandoned it.
-Civilisations are unbalanced
-AI is broken
-Multiplayer is pretty much dead

Playing with a couple of friends could be fun if you all play as the same faction, but please don't support the devs by buying anything in-game. If I knew this game wasn't updated in years beforehand, I would not even try to buy anything in-game. Luckily, factions aren't that expensive but still, I was bummed that I supported these developers that have a nerve to charge people for skins and factions in a abandoned game.

review:
Ce jeu avait pour moi un immense potentiel, des graphismes attirants, capable de tourn√©e m√™me sur des ordinateur LOW... Et en plus un concept qui reprenais bien les Ages of Empires qui √©taient d'excellent jeux, je parles des originaux, pas des remast√©ris√©e √† la noix. 

Mais c'est un jeux qui au d√©but semble simple √† comprendre, pourtant rien que pour changer d'√¢ge j'ai du demand√© au d√©veloppeurs, comment on fait (autant dire que les guides du jeu sont d√©j√† inexistant) r√©ponse, d√©sol√© on fonctionne pas comme √ßa, donc il n'y a pas moyen... ????
... ah et pourquoi alors on me demande de passer √† l'age 2, comment on fait pur√©e?? 

Voil√†, bref le d√©veloppement du jeu pour moi est rest√© risible et une pale tentative de copie des Age of, qui restent √† un niveau extr√™mement pitoyable, et surtout impossible d'apprendre ce jeu en autodidacte, dans combien de jeux de ce genre suis je aller chercher un guide? 0 sauf celui l√† et en plus les r√©ponses n'y sont pas, et leur dev sont pas foutus de r√©pondre non plus. Et ce en anglais comme en fran√ßais

review:
El juego en s√≠ est√° bien. Es como una versi√≥n simplificada del Age of Empires y con algunas mec√°nicas nuevas que me parecen interesantes. La parte gr√°fica, como amante del lowpoly, me gusta bastante. Hay 8 civilizaciones distintas, con unidades y mec√°nicas muy diferenciadas, pero son todas de pago salvo los bizantinos. Teniendo en cuenta que el juego es gratis no me parece mal, simplemente es otro modelo de negocio.

Vale, entonces... est√° todo bien? Pues no, y es que el mayor problema de este juego es que no hay pr√°cticamente jugadores. El tiempo de b√∫squeda de una partida clasificatoria suele ser de 10 minutos de media, si es que aparece alguien contra quien jugar. Adem√°s, si decides olvidarte del multiplayer y jugar contra la IA te vas a llevar otro chasco, porque la IA es bastante mala. Y lo peor, es que llevan sin actualizar el juego como 2 a√±os, as√≠ que seguramente solo vaya a peor.

Para acabar, le dar√© al juego un voto positivo porque creo que el juego en s√≠ se lo merece, pero es una pena que est√© tan muerto y no tiene pinta de que nadie le vaya a tirar una cola de f√©nix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083607374', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1620887113}
review:
This game is LEGIT dude.
It is COMPLETELY. LEGIT DUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

TLDR: Why human factions? make custom races...you'd sell more..i think this is due to democrat developers having autism and literally not being able to express themselves or be creative. if you had custom races i would have dropped 100$ on this game and all the DLC's. the game is smooth af too like wtf are you doing?
p.s. It's Age Of Mythology 2...just without the fun/creative/lore/world-build/races/factions etc

5/10
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Long Versions:
my only problem with it is (i feel like anyways, need to put in more time and idk if i will just because there arent custom/unique factions) it has the fast paced play starcraft 2 does, but then it has this age of mythology feel? Idk maybe it's just me. anyways.

I wish instead of just human factions you developers would just make custom/creative fucking races/factions. How hard is it to do that? You BUILD. AND CODE. AN ENTIRE GAME. and you dont want to be creative? 
go f*** yourselves for that. i stare at the aztec exp. and the arabia exp and i get excited, but then i realize its just human units but it is kind of neat. there's a reason people look at those factions and get excited. We dont want humans, we want custom races like ENDLESS LEGENDS did (too bad endless legends is a shitty 4x. 4x suck lmfao. anyways)

This game needs a HUGE expansion for 20-30$ and basically make it like 5 custom unique races. and i'd buy it. im not joking start a kickstarter and you can be my first kickstarter 'donation'.

Some idea's since you have no brainpower of your own:
-----------------------------------------------------------
Orcs
+Shades
+Essentenial (or Sentenials)(essence/spirit/blue/white race)
+Necrophage (from endless legends, but its the most creative shit ive seen so im copying and pasting it here (literally any endless legends races will inspire any dev to make their own custom factions/races)
+Scarlet Crusaders (the only human faction that should exist and idk if you should even put that in since u have 5 human races already)
+Thoraxx (barbarian, pelt-wearing, ent/nature/druidic race, tribal race that worship the wolf, bear, and ox and has strong units that are mythological in nature, giant baphomet type creatures, large tree ents etc)

there you go just handed you 5-6 good ones for free. get to it.

4.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071067549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1620246852}
review: Pretty fun game. It's similar to Age of Empires 2 but it has its own flavor. The base building and upgrading aspect is more streamlined than AoE2, but the battles have a neat twist (for example the French fight by chargiing into the enemy from a far distance and dealing damage in a big blow). Also the civilizations are more different from each other than in AoE2, but at the same time not as different as Starcraft 2, which makes this game strike a very nice balance between the two games in that regard. Pretty fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298836379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1687023120}
review:
El juego es bueno, porque es como un age of empires 1 y 2 pero mas simple divertido para jugar con los amigos tiene estos pros
-las facciones se diferencian bastante por ejemplo los franceses tienen un bonus con caballer√≠a pero los bizantinos son buenos en infanter√≠a 
-el juego es simple y f√°cil de entender 
-los modos de juegos son muy parecidos al age of empires 2 y el sistema de counters es casi el mismo 
-la jugabilidad es bastante decente y muy parecida al age of empires pero al ser mas simple las partidas pueden ser un poco mas cortas
-es gratis
contras
-los servers del juego son malos ya que sale errores de sincronizacion frecuentes (incluso si juegas con bots o con amigos)
-esta un poco mal optimizado ya que hay bajadas de frames frecuentes
-los el desvalanceo de unas pocas civilizaciones como los mongoles
concluyo que el juego es muy bueno pero necesita atencion en los servidores en linea y una mejor optimizacion pero aparte de eso el juego es excelente y sirve como una alternativa muy fiel al age of empires

review:
TLDR: This game is Age of Empires II but in 3D.
Pro:
-Good looking simple graphics

Cons: 
-You have to buy all the other civilizations by paying.
-Not many other civilizations compared to AoE II.
-Controlling units is stiff and choppy

author: {'steamid': '76561198067281848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1564649785}
review:
If you're new to RTS and you are not sure if you want to spend money or about the genre in general, this is a good place to start, its free and its layout is pretty similar to many RTS games out there. So I would definitely recommend it. You may enjoy this genre a ton! 

If you're not new to RTS, this may not be your game. Personally I did not think it was that bad, its just that as I had many other RTS games to play, did not spend much time on it as you'll be able to see. Its very similar to Age of Empires, gameplay wise, which I already had and play. What drew me in was the art style, unfortunately, did not stay long enough to see if it had more to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807860857', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1705507176}
review:
The game is really nice and fun to play with friends...
There are a few bugs though: You can't delete an AI once you added it to your players list. Also the button to add the AI in fitst place wiggles a bit when you press it. This is a GUI issue tho. You could simply fix it by putting the button to another place or differ between the text and the button so both of it doesn't move at once.
I would say that I have a decent PC (20GB DDR4, 4GB Nvidia GTX 970, Intel i5 6500); I can run multiple FPS-Games at over 100 fps, but when there are about three or four hundred troops on the field the game is getting laggy and my frames drop to about eight. I am assuming it is due to poor programming. (Don't get this wrong your game is awesome and I like it alot; it is just a suggestion)
Some of the features I would really like to see:

1. You should be able to build gates with all civilizations (I played the aztecs; maybe i just didn't see it, in that case just ignore the first point)

2. Your allies should be able to pass your gates

3. There should be a safe function for custom games (by pressing a button in the game menu you could simply download a save file and upload it if you want to continue)

4.  There should be a survival gamemode for customs too

These are just some suggestions of a newbie. I know not all of them are gonna be adopted. I am really going to be happy if at least one of the listed aspects are going to be adopted or at least considered adding.

Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352355984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1667158640}
review:
Playing it alone or against randoms is pretty boring, not much to say there.
However, with friends this is easily one of the most interesting and fun games you can play for free :)

Im gonna start with some positives; The games core mechanics are suprisingly simple, (At least when you get a hold of the main rules and controlls.., If you¬¥re open to new strategies and taking risks you can find alot of diffrent playstyles, maps and in turn, experiences. Remember to have you¬¥re friends with you, I recommend the stupid ones as they make it so riddiculasly funny, and also they don¬¥t put up competiton.

Now some cons; The game takese a really long time, like seriously, A LOT OF TIME. Ones I played one measly round for 2 hours straight, all because we realised that we all had such good defenses that a attack whould leave our bases open for attackers, how did it end? My mom unplugging the wifi and killing my PC and the server with it. Heres another con, while it is a simple game, it¬¥s still a stratedgy game. A play this game with a friend who plays a bunch of strat-games and he DOMINATES everyone. Where talking ¬¥bout a guy who has three layers of goddang walls, all coverd by fortresses and max-leveld towers, while you¬¥re sitting there with your open-ass base and one spearman to defend it. And finally... the servers are kinda laggy, wich I can live with, but it gets pretty bad when you¬¥re playing with a lot of people. I play with about five friends, and I have to limit the amount of troops we can have, because if armies get to big then whe¬¥re down to 4fps. And if thoose router destroying armies fight each other? Well my sweet, sweet gamers you can kiss your fricking PC goodbye!

Conclusion; It is a really fun game with the right people. I recommend trying it out with some friends since it¬¥s a really small game, and it¬¥s free! However, remember to have a clear schedual when playing, and beware the lag! So go ahead, try it out, find some friends to play it with, and remember that you can always delete if you don¬¥t like since it is free.

Important thing to keep in mind:  The DLC can be pretty busted, or pretty shit. Basically, you don¬¥t want to get the mongol civilization, it¬¥s basically only good for annoying you¬¥re friends by moving your townhall all around the map and never dying but never winning. However the french one is BUSTED, you literally replace bows with FRICKING CANNONS. And also never invite my friend Sebbe to a game cause his trippledecker-thicc as ass-tower infested-lag causing-holy shit-baby kicking walls will inevedably not only destroy you¬¥re server, but the entire f***ing internet one day.

(Im a nooby white dissapointment, and I approve this message :) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198116517331', 'num_games_owned': 3242, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 3092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1676989984}
review:
If all you are looking for is a limited feature, free to play Age of Empires clone where you can play skirmish matches with the AI, this works fine.  The AI is somewhat lacking; even the hardest setting isn't too tough.

Problem is, you are limited to using only one civilization unless you pay for others or go through a tiresome unlocking process.  Also, the multiplayer community is dead.  Some achievements require multiplayer too.

Classic RTS games tend to be cheap, especially at discount, so you shouldn't spend one cent on this when there better alternatives.  But if you simply want some simple AI skirmishes and don't want to pay anything at all, this is okay.

review:
From the very first moment you play this, you will see that it's Age of Empires II

...But with no singleplayer story (yet)

...And you have to pay for each additional faction

...And it has lootboxes

But underneath all of that, it's still Age of Empires II. And it's free, so why not try it?

author: {'steamid': '76561198044995384', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1652707133}
review:
Tl;dr - Fun game, nice art style. It could use some balancing (1) and polish (2) . Its relatively free (3) so check it out !

(1)  The AI doesn't put up much of a fight and I don't think they even play the game if they are the mongol tribe.

(2)  Simple things like: In multiplayer there is no way to pause as far as i know. Unit pathing is a bit weird. I don't see much use for late game units, at least not against bots. Some extra late game buildings could be fun.

(3) One faction is free, the others drop in loot boxes. It might take a while to unlock a new faction, luckily i had the game bug out on me a couple times and give me a faction i didn't unlock yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064165134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1710531528}
review:
It's free & it's fun.

I will say that the game play gets a little stale after awhile and to win all you got to do is make tons of archers.

review:
[quote] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/]Ba≈ülamadan √∂nce diƒüer incelemelerimin olduƒüu k√ºrat√∂r sayfamƒ± takip edin.[/url] [/quote]

ƒ∞yi d√º≈ü√ºn√ºlm√º≈ü ve √ßok keyifli bir oyun. √úcretsiz olmasƒ± da cabasƒ±. Fakat ciddi optimizasyon ve oyuncu sorunu var.

Empires Apart bildiƒüimiz ger√ßek zamanlƒ± strateji oyunlarƒ±nƒ±n √ßok g√ºzel ve √ºcretsiz bir versiyonu. Hikaye modu... nasƒ±l desem yok gibi. √áok basit√ße d√º≈ü√ºn√ºlm√º≈ü birka√ß g√∂revin dƒ±≈üƒ±nda tek ki≈üilik oyuncu modu neredeyse yok diyebilirim.

Grafikleri son d√∂nemlerde √∂zellikle mobil oyunlarda g√∂rd√ºƒü√ºm√ºz tarzda i≈ülenmi≈ü. Tatlƒ± ve basit ama bir o kadar da g√∂ze ho≈ü geliyor. G√∂rsel a√ßƒ±dan baktƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±zda oyunun ciddi gereksinimler istemediƒüini anlamak hi√ß zor deƒüil. Zaten boyutu da √ßok k√º√ß√ºk bir oyun. Fakat bu sizi kandƒ±rmasƒ±n. K√º√ß√ºk boyutu ve basit grafiklerine raƒümen ciddi optimizasyon sorunlarƒ±ndan dolayƒ± oyun i√ßerisinde sorun ya≈üayabiliyorsunuz. √ñzellikle 1'e 1 veya 2'ye 2 atmƒ±yorsanƒ±z oyunun orta safhasƒ±na geldiƒüinizde kare sayƒ±nƒ±zda ciddi bir d√º≈ü√º≈ü oluyor.

Mekanikler klasik ger√ßek zamanlƒ± strateji oyunu mekaniklerinden. Sadece birimler veya binalar gibi ≈üeyler biraz farklƒ±. Daha √∂nce bu t√ºrde oyun oynayanlar i√ßin alƒ±≈ümak hi√ß zaman almayacaktƒ±r eminim. Oynanƒ±≈ü konusunda en b√ºy√ºk sƒ±kƒ±ntƒ± yukarƒ±da bahsettiƒüim kare sayƒ±sƒ±ndaki d√º≈ü√º≈üler. Bir ba≈üka belirtmek istediƒüim konu ise oynanƒ±≈ütaki kƒ±sa yollarƒ±n eksikliƒüi. Yani oyun sizi bo≈ü mekanikleri s√ºrekli elle kontrol etmeye itiyor. Bir yerde bir sorun √ßƒ±ktƒ±ƒüƒ±nda bunu hep el ile halletmek zorunda kalƒ±yorsunuz. Yapay zekasƒ± ger√ßekten k√∂t√º durumda (bu birimlerin yol harita √ºzerinde yol bulma kabiliyetini de k√∂t√º etkiliyor). ƒ∞≈üin en k√∂t√º yanƒ± ise neye tƒ±klanƒ±p neye tƒ±klanmayacaƒüƒ±nƒ± ayƒ±rt edemiyor olu≈üunuz. Bundan kastƒ±m bir simgenin tƒ±klanabilir olup olmadƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± ayƒ±rt etmenin zor olduƒüu. √ñrneƒüin bir simge beliriyor bildirim olarak bu simgeye tƒ±klamaya √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yorum tƒ±klanmƒ±yor veya kendi kendine yok oluyor gibi ≈üeyler oluyor. Ben tƒ±kladƒ±m da mƒ± gitti ne bildirimiydi o filan anlayamƒ±yorsunuz.

√úzerinde konu≈üulmasƒ± gerek tek ≈üey sanƒ±rƒ±m Civilization Pack adƒ± altƒ±nda satƒ±lan ek paketler. Oyun i√ßerisinde t√ºm medeniyetleri maalesef oynayamƒ±yorsunuz. Oyunun ba≈üƒ±nda sadece 1 adet medeniyetiniz oluyor ve o da Bizanslƒ±lar oluyor. Ayrƒ±ca belirtmek isterim ki bunu deƒüi≈ütiremiyorsunuz. Otomatik olarak size atanƒ±yor ve oyun i√ßerisinde oynayarak ba≈üka medeniyetleri a√ßma gibi bir ≈üansƒ±nƒ±z yok. ≈ûuan 10.50‚Ç∫ fiyatƒ±na satƒ±lan ek paketleri satƒ±n alarak a√ßabiliyorsunuz. T√ºm medeniyetleri a√ßmak isterseniz (indirimsiz haliyle) 63‚Ç∫ gibi bir fiyat √∂demeniz gerekiyor. √úcretsiz bir oyun i√ßin b√∂yle bir √∂deme duvarƒ± koymak ger√ßekten √ßok sa√ßma geliyor bana. Bunun yerine 30‚Ç∫ gibi bir fiyatla oyunu satsalar daha √ßok kar edeceklerini d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum. 

Daha √∂nce bahsettiƒüim gibi oyunun hikaye modu neredeyse yok zaten fakat i≈üin k√∂t√º yanƒ± √ßok oyunculu kƒ±smƒ± da yok. Yani √∂yle bir mod var ama oynayan insan yok. Tamamen √∂l√º durumda. Buna en b√ºy√ºk etken k√∂t√º d√ºzeydeki optimizasyon ve medeniyetlerin DLC olarak satƒ±lmasƒ± ≈üahsƒ±mca.

Daha √ßok geli≈ütirilmesi lazƒ±m bence oyunun. Hem pazarlama hem oynanƒ±≈ü a√ßƒ±sƒ±ndan. Maalesef ≈üuan ki haliyle oynamanƒ±zƒ± tavsiye edemem. 50SP

author: {'steamid': '76561198003726208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 5020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4067, 'last_played': 1597608535}
review:
An Age of Empires like game. This game had potential. Sadly enough Empires Apart has not had an update in over a year. I will never play the game the same amount I played Age Of Empires II, but the game is worth giving a try. Especialy because now there are still players left to play with.

+ Happy/Colourful graphics.
+ Auto farm reseeding.
+ Cool features, for example: Day and night cycle (when its night you have less line of sight).

- Not many players online.
- No steam workshop.
- It seems the developers abondoned the game.

review:
Premetto che ho giocato la versione gratuita. La grafica √® davvero imbarazzante, pur non essendo un requisito necessario per questo tipo di giochi. Ho provato diverse volte a fare duelli on-line ma dopo 10/20 min di gioco crasha il programma, ho anche riprovato a riavviare il gioco ed a reinizializzare la partita gi√† in corso senza alcun successo.... svariati minuti di attesa per il caricamento che non portano a nulla...
Nel complesso,a mio parere, √® un gioco incompleto e con tanti, tantissimi problemi....
C'√® anche da dire che la versione base √® gratuita... per√≤ di sicuro non spenderei alcuna cifra per comprarmi il gioco completo..

author: {'steamid': '76561198305716968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1610447567}
review:
THIS REVIEW IS WRITTEN IN SPANISH AND ENGLISH

[MESSAGE IN ENGLISH]
It is a very entertaining game, however I find that certain mechanics are a bit difficult and I think that the game itself should have a story mode of each civilization to explain its pros and cons in addition to adding content to the game, cinematic dialogues ect ...
Also expand the competitive multiplayer mode so that you can play with a friend 2vs2 against people, add sandbox to be able to test city and organization models, with unlimited resources, without the need for villagers and without construction time.
Finally I think it would be necessary to make a reduction per year in the price of civilizations so that we can buy them cheaper, in addition to that they could add every 6 months new civilizations such as the Spanish, the Egyptians or the Vikings.
I hope that if someone from the company reads this, they will be interested in putting in some idea of ‚Äã‚Äãmine soon, since I think it will benefit the game a lot and they are not excessively complicated.

[MENSAJE EN ESPA√ëOL]
Es un juego muy entretenido, sin embargo encuentro que ciertas mec√°nicas son un poco dif√≠ciles y creo que el propio juego deber√≠a tener un modo historia de cada civilizaci√≥n para explicar sus pros y contras ademas de para a√±adir contenido al juego, cinem√°ticas di√°logos ect...
Tambi√©n ampliar el modo multijugador competitivo para que se pueda jugar con un amigo 2vs2 contra personas, a√±adir sandbox para poder probar modelos de ciudad y de organizaci√≥n, con recursos ilimitados, sin necesidad de tener aldeanos y sin tiempo de construcci√≥n.
Por √∫ltimo creo que seria necesario hacer una rebaja al a√±o en el precio de las civilizaciones para que podemas comprarlas mas baratas, ademas de que podrian a√±adir cada 6 meses nuevas civilizaciones como los Espa√±oles, los Egipcios o los Vikingos. 
Espero que si alguien de la empresa lee esto se interese por meter alguna idea mia pronto, ya que creo q beneficiara mucho al juego y no son excesivamente complicadas.

review: Okay, so, i tried this out. Tutorial was easy enough, but it turns out, entering anything else it SUCKED. I like to play these games slowly and this games AI has 5 different modes. So i choose Easiest, and theres only one. I choose diplomacy mode. Apparently, the ai can generate units immediately, so i had to face off against about 100 cavalrymen. The combat is so screwed up, honestly... I'm sorry, but i cant recommend this. It was good in theory, but bad in practice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166017876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1656616479}
review: I haven't found many bugs like my friends have, and so I actually really like this game. It has great graphics and mechanics, and I like it a lot. It's even free to play so it's not like you'll want a refund. But there's one thing, I wouldn't call it a bug, but instead it's a serious flaw. You can't deconstruct things. Other people can break your buildings, but you can't do that yourself. Even if another person does do that, they might not destroy the thing you want them to, and instead beat you and win the game. Though so far it hasn't been a problem because I have been placing my buildings carefully, later when I start to try to win and start building walls it will be a problem, because I can't break them for expansions and will need to build around them instead of building bigger walls and destroying the first. I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087831859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1589183654}
review:
SHORT and on point: - is this a "Age Of Empires" copy? 

ANSWER: YES and no. 

WHY?
While it reminded me SO MANY times of AOE, I guess most RTS games nowadays copy many things from AOE or gamers have grown up expecting all medieval RTS games to play exactly like AOE, that developers try to implement things from AOE's gameplay as much as possible.

Why AOE?

I am not a big RTS gamer, but I have played AOE 1, 2, 3... and just recently had a nostalgic AOE feeling, 
BUT wanted to try something NEW and SIMILAR (interesting, huh?). 
From small things, like how the peasants react, work, wait etc.
From how you build houses, barracks etc. 
"AOE" is written all over the place. 

- LIKE:
THIS is NOT bad, do not get me wrong. 
I like when AOE gets a "lift up" and do not care who takes on the torch. 
I like the poly style and it feels like a refreshing AOE, 
but I do feel that in an RTS like this, I miss the handdrawn and -colored styles more. 
(It helps set the feeling of "medieval" wars and world)
Music, gameplay, the 3D world, all feel pretty mature and nicely done. 
Overall, when I feel to build some houses and kick some a**, this game is no headache. 

- DISLIKE:
I wish for a proper PAUSE button. Do not know what is wrong with games nowadays, 
but they do not even let you take a P. When you press "Menu", the game plays further...
Speaking of menu, this part migh need a rehaul or a nicer design - I guess the devs are focusing on the game 
and gameplay, which is a priority and I get that. 
The A.I. is pretty strong, also on medium. Just joking - this is a good part. 
Wish that you could rotate the camera. 

I DO UNDERSTAND that this is a demo aka early access, so I guess that the game might have a future if further developed.
@Devs: thanks for the demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967243577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1534, 'last_played': 1587946548}
review:
Apr√®s quelques heures de jeu solo.

Les plus:
- Le style graphique √©pur√© et efficace.
- Le nombre de factions et de classes satisfaisant.
- Les arbres technologiques raisonnablement fournis.
- Une agr√©able bande son.

Les moins:
- Des scripts tr√®s faillibles. Une fois contr√©e l'IA entre en l√©thargie.
- Le pathfinding est tr√®s en retard.
- Manque d'ergonomie g√©n√©rale, tant dans le choix des raccourcis clavier que dans les menus.
- Une pauvret√© d'option de gestion qui est d'autant plus frustrante qu'elle mal mise en place.

Nous avons l√† un jeu sobre dot√© d'un joli visuel plein de promesses, qui se voit cependant irr√©m√©diablement g√¢ch√© par son ergonomie et son manque de profondeur technique.
Un petit jeu nettement en dessous des classiques du genre qu'il imite sans en atteindre les subtilit√©s.
A n'acheter qu'en promotion.

review:
This is a really good game, I am glad someone made a better AOE2 because it was much needed. There are a few issues though: 

1. The game speed is pretty slow, there should be an option to play on fast and even faster 
2. The color balance of the game is odd, it just makes the game look weird
3. Sometimes the game drops FPS just after daytime ends and nighttime begins
4. The game is rather zoomed in, please give an option to zoom out more

review: Only played the AI and not online but this part doesn't bother me anyway. It is obviously an Age of Empires inspired game and does add some stuff and takes away others. Its fun to play and is a good game in its own right. My only 2 complaints is the units are hard to tell apart, but a few more battles might help this. The only thing is upgrade don't feel like they make a massive difference. In AoE upgrading from men at arms up to champions is a massive  improvement but here it is hard to tell a difference. It does matter however as i had a smaller army but won the battle so the upgrades had to have helped it just doesn't feel like it

Ce jeu est vraiment bien fait que ce soit au niveau graphisme ou gameplay. Si vous aimez les RTS vous allez aimer c'est s√ªr ! L√©ger point n√©gatif : c'est tr√®s tr√®s long pour avoir des civilisations suppl√©mentaires sans acheter. Tout le monde joue byzantin presque et d√®s qu'on tombe sur une civilisation √©trang√®re c'est la d√©faite assur√©e si on ne conna√Æt pas la civilisation adverse.

Ce jeu n'est pas un pay to win mais c'est rageant de se faire renverser par des Azt√®ques...

Faites des jeton de civilisation simple comme √ßa on peut acheter la civilisation que l'on veut avec 4 jetons au lieu de les attribuer de base √† une civilisation. Soyez aussi plus g√©n√©reux sur la mont√©e en niveau ou en qu√™te parce que c'est super long aussi !

author: {'steamid': '76561198131402930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1593417942}
review:
I've played only the tutorial, and watched some games.
Graphics: I love this kind of graphics well it is a personal thing! but with a GTX 970 Ultra was using 100% of my GPU power only in the tutorial, Ouch!
Gameplay: _ User interface is Cool I like it to be loose without static boxes everywhere
                  _ Each Society having its own building visuals is so cool!
                  _ Each Society having its own perks based on real life History is well done!
                  _ Army formations is nice!
However some improvements:
_ hold right click and move the mouse event to line up your troops in a direction
_ villagers needs to have morale, like they need bathes, libraries, shops, schools or they work slower
_ soldiers also needs to have morale, like ++perks after winning a small battle, if they fight near their fort ++perks, if they fight behind their walls ++perks, Leader speeches ++perks, --perks if they kill villagers, --perks if they are being attacked by archers....
_ villagers should be able to defend themselves
_ larger mineral deposits
_ leaders to lead the army with perks
_ and the best of them all soldiers need to have a better response, like if you select the spear men and mark him to prioritize horsemen at first clash he attacks the nearest enemy but if a horseman and a swordsman are both in front of him he goes for the horseman, same to the archers if 20 archers are attacking a single target and only 10 can kill 1 the other 10 needs to be attacking someone else!!!
_ make a mode in online playing: defender and attacker, where the defender needs to build forts and walls and defend the attacker where each having perks helping him in his purpose

overall it is a fine to nice game which needs more development, i think this is still beta!

author: {'steamid': '76561198368894651', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1622232357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088982873', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1583595469}
review:
This game has so many weird things. One of them being unable to properly play with AI, since they will eventually steal all your resource nodes leaving you with none. Seriously, what the hell is that about?
The AI also loves building in your cities, blocking your plans of how you planned on building.

Maybe tone down the AI a bit, devs? I thought it'd be fun playing with AI, regular Skirmish AI battles, but nope, I was wrong. It's fucking annoying and unplayable after a certain time limit where the AI decides "this is da way I go now" and builds anywhere they want and grab all resource nodes from under your nose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314683075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4504, 'last_played': 1660768671}
review:
Points positifs :

-Le jeu est tr√®s beau graphiquement parlant, j'aime beaucoup ce c√¥t√© du jeu !
-La m√©canique du jeu est super (j'adore ce type de jeu), cela ressemble √† AOE !
-Le jeu offre quelques modes de jeu mais seulement 2 sont bien : multijoueur et escarmouche solo avec IA.
-La dur√©e de vie du jeu est correcte moi je ne m'en lasse toujours pas apr√®s 72h de jeu ! Super sympa √† jouer avec des potes !
-Le jeu offre la possibilit√© d'acheter des factions suppl√©mentaires √† 4‚Ç¨, le gameplay change totalement avec celles-ci vu leurs caract√©ristiques ! Mais le meilleurs c'est qu'elles n'avantage pas trop ceux qui sont rest√©s avec la civilisation de base (tr√®s correcte elle m√™me)
-Je trouve le jeu bien √©quilibr√© pour ma part !
-Pour finir avec les points positifs : Le jeu est gratuit ! Et √ßa c'est vraiment g√©nial rien √† dire l√† dessus !

-Points n√©gatifs :

-La consommation du jeu... C'est trop √©lev√© ! Mon ordinateur chauffe beaucoup trop ! Je pense le jeu mal cod√© de ce c√¥t√© l√† ! (m√™me en qualit√© graphique basse !)
-Aucuns acc√®s au workshop ! Aucunes possibilit√©s de maps suppl√©mentaires par exemple ! Dommage !
-Les IA... Une catastrophe... Exemples :
          -Des fois les IA jouent correctement mais d'autres fois elles sont comme... AFK ? Elles ne font rien ou presque !
          -Leurs arm√©es ! M√™me en mode "Plus difficile" leur arm√©e n'est pas super super... Le d√©but est chaud et puis la fin tranquille !
          -Revenons sur les arm√©e justement... Parfois les IA font des arm√©es de... paysans !! Juste des paysans... Avec 10 chevaux leur village est ras√©... Et encore
          -Les portes automatiques... Quand les portes sont automatiques, elles se ferme quand un ennemis arrive et s'ouvre quand c'est un alli√©, l√† n'est pas le probl√®me mais les IA adverses d√©tectent la porte ouverte quand elle est sur automatique ! Donc leur arm√©e arrive (elle se fait tirer dessus) puis les portes se ferme (logique) donc l'IA d√©tecte que c'est ferm√© et repart ! 5 secondes plus tard les portes se r√©-ouvre donc l'arm√©e revient et se fait encore tirer dessus ! Les IA meurt toutes seules !!
          -Les IA ne construisent pas de murs... C'est juste trop facile ! Aucuns remparts pour nos guerriers, juste des ferme en face, vous imaginez le carnage gratuit...
Finis pour les IA !
-Le mode survie (les IA vous lancent des vagues d'ennemis)... Grosse erreur la dessus ! Que 2 filons de pierre et d'or ! On ne peut pas faire une muraille compl√®te, la carte est trop petite et il manque des arbres ! Inf√¢me ce mode ! Plus de pierre : plus de remparts ! Plus de bois : Plus de ferme donc plus de nourriture ! Plus d'or : plus d'arm√©e... Il nous reste quoi ?
-Pour finir... Devs ? Vous √™tes o√π ? vous faites quoi en fait ? Aucune mise √† jour pour r√©gler les bugs et probl√®mes que l'on vous signal ! Je suis sur que vous ne poserez m√™me pas un oeil sur ce commentaires ! Mais le pire c'est que depuis l cr√©ation du jeu, il y a des maps marqu√©es "en d√©veloppement"... Mais bien s√ªr !! Il vous faut combien de temps pour cr√©er une seule map ? 3 ans ?

Pour conclure : Manque d'activit√© des d√©veloppeur (pas un petit manque hein...) Je recommande tout de m√™me le jeu car la m√©canique est bonne, les graphisme sont bon et le jeu est gratuit

Note globale : 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198010241329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1575942907}
review:
As a long time AOE2 fan, this games not half bad.

Although there are some main flaws such as  :

Wonky AI that somehow snowballs early, comes at you with 50-100 units , but then retreats, for the rest of the game it acts like it has absolutely no idea what its doing. The first "tutorial" skirmish i played the AI ramped up so quickly, it was insane, i wasnt even taking my time. 

Saw an issue where my ally somehow accepted an alliance with our 1 mutual enemy late game and just sat around watching me fight him.

Idk it could be a cool game. I opened some chests after a game, got 2 purple legendary items but have absolutely no idea where they went.. Looks like you can equip different cosmetics on your units which is pretty neat.

Theres a "try" before you buy option for the paid to play factions, i appreciate that.

I may come back to this later if the AI improves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259343058', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1596792167}
review: The game is fairly well-rounded, though the harder and hardest bots are a challenge for newer players, since they can out-tech you pretty fast, though the game is very well polished. I would like it if there was a game history log added to the game to review past matches to see mistakes made in the previous game. Another feature to give the game more depth is if they add a more complex tree of economy or military, especially mutually exclusive branches. This can help to prevent players from getting every single building the moment they have the resources for it and just focus only on efficiency and stacking, rather than carefully considering how they want to use and manage both their resources and troop classes (unless presented with multiple enemies in one game), causing the game to lose its strategic orientation and just be about grinding to get all the upgrades as fast as possible. (Edit: Pls fix the lag issue when multiple bots are present)

review: After only 2 hours of play, I am quite impressed with this free RTS. It is like Age of Empires 2 in 3D, just what AOE3 should have been. review:
[b]Empires Apart[/b] to bardzo dobra i wciƒÖgajƒÖca, a co najwa≈ºniejsze darmowa (obecnie) gra strategiczna, odczuwalnie posiadajƒÖca duszƒô gry Age of Empires (a nawet jej klon), lecz prezentujƒÖca siƒô we w≈Çasnym nowoczesnym stylu - co nie jest z≈Çe, pr√≥cz tego ≈ºe mikrotransakcje, kuferki, wystƒôpujƒÖ tu a≈º mi≈Ço.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]

OmijajƒÖc mikrotransakcje, skrzyneczki, kosmetykƒô itp. w samej grze, bo [b]mo≈ºna graƒá bez tego r√≥wnie≈º[/b] ‚Äì to przed naszymi oczami ukazujƒô siƒô dobra gra strategiczna.

PoczƒÖtkowe wprowadzenie, samouczek, sama gra to odczuwalny klon dobrze znanego przez wszystkich [b]Age of Empires[/b] ‚Äì w formie bardziej pociƒôtej, z racji tego ≈ºe tw√≥rca oferujƒÖc darmowy tytu≈Ç na pozosta≈Çych aspektach bƒôdzie chcia≈Ç zarobiƒá.

BiorƒÖc pod uwagƒô ≈ºe na rynku pojawi≈Ça siƒô od≈õwie≈ºona edycja gry [b]Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition[/b], bƒÖd≈∫ mo≈ºna nabyƒá starszƒÖ lecz nadal dzia≈ÇajƒÖcƒÖ wersje owego tytu≈Çu ‚Äì to czy Empires Apart jest warta naszego czasu? 

Moim skromnym zdaniem - Tak.

[h1]Empires Apart czy Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition?[/h1]

Z jednej strony mamy darmowƒÖ produkcje, do≈õƒá mocno pociƒôtƒÖ lecz dajƒÖca du≈ºo zabawy w grze z komputerowym przeciwnikiem lub innym graczem.

Z drugiej strony znacznie bogatsza grƒô pod ka≈ºdym wzglƒôdem Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition w cenie ok 92z≈Ç (cena Steam), edycje pude≈Çkowe starszych edycji gry ok 20z≈Ç.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

Empires Apart to bardzo dobra gra, nowoczesny klon Age of Empires, jest darmowa, daje du≈ºo zabawy w grze z komputerowym przeciwnikiem jak i prawdziwym graczem ‚Äì lecz nie spodziewajcie siƒô rozbudowanych element√≥w, zawarto≈õci kt√≥ry ma AoE.

Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287302928', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1575576771}
review:
Empires Apart √® uno strategico in tempo reale ben realizzato, che soffre di un problema tipico di molti giochi essenzialmente online, pubblicati per qualche mese in Accesso Anticipato: la carenza di giocatori abbordabili per i neofiti. Per il resto √® difficile trovargli dei veri e propri difetti, a parte una certa carenza di contenuti. DESTINYbit ha scelto di concentrarsi su alcuni aspetti, che ha curato benissimo, cos√¨ da evitare di disperdere le energie per abbozzare mille caratteristiche, senza per√≤ portarle a compimento.

PRO

Meccaniche base rifinite
Buona configurabilit√† delle partite, online e offline
Fazioni varie e ben caratterizzate

CONTRO

Il single player √® sostanzialmente una grossa modalit√† di allenamento
Qualche problema di pathfinding dell'intelligenza artificiale

Voto : 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198294511742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1581473783}
review:
It's free to play Age of Empires 2, essentially, and it's actually pretty good. You start with the Byzantine civ for free, and the other civs cost money. Every day you play you can get chests, one for the first game you win, and one each time you go up a level. Chests give you appearance customization options for your units and whatnot mostly, but if you're lucky you can get random sigil drops. Collect four sigils from a civilization, and you get that civ for free. So, if you're willing to spend time grinding, and RNGeezus is good to you, then the whole game is free to play. Eventually.
I still think it's a pretty good game, although some more skirmish maps would be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061668113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1579705432}
review:
Played a few multiplayer games, starting to really enjoy this game. 

Pros:
-My PC specs are slightly lower than their minimum and run this game super smooth on medium settings. 
-Gameplay is pretty smooth, a nice array of units, game is not too over complicated. Only a few levels for you civilization to progress through, which I honestly prefer, rather than going from 0-100. 
-Games won't take ridiculously long, some real tactics can be used, this game is like a Age of Empires kinda game with cooler civilizations. 

Cons:
-There is only ONE free civilization, I reckon atleast 2 or 3 would be good to build a bigger fan-base. (biggest issue IMO)
Maps could be a bit bigger, they're quite small? Probably like 20% bigger would be perfect.

End points: 

-I was actually surprised that I have been able to find online games pretty quickly and easily: like 5 mins MAX, for ranked games. 
-At the end of the day, this game is free and pretty enjoyable to kill some time and test your strategy, however it is quite simple and does not allowed for any crazy tactics other than defending an early rush or rushing someone. 

6.8/10

-Would be like 7.5 or higher if there were more civilizations available from the beginning, or a slightly more complex pathway for the Byzantines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038751912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1569740673}
review:
I honestly thought that for a F2P game, this was going to be another game I spent no more than an hour on. As of writing this, I've been absorbed in the game itself. It is fantastically built, and is a gem in my library!

The only negative I have is that not enough people play it. I sit for far too long in the queue, but this is due simply to a lack of players. 

Download it, try it... It's free. And I guarantee it'll be time well spent.

review: This game is literally age of empires 2 with loot boxes and you have to buy the factions. The game mechanics are actually taken completely from age of empires 2 except i would argue it has LESS content. Like the developers only took the units and factions they needed to sell the game. This is just a huge cash grab and I wouldn't be surprised if this game breaks some form of copyright laws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005377742', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 6634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1576931911}
review:
You need to make it on MAC!!!!

This game is a love letter to RTS games of the 1990s and the early 2000s. The art style and the unique civs are great, and I can't wait to see if there is more content that will be added. Only issue is the lack of a singleplayer campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012030272', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1569170955}
review:
Played for just a few minutes, but it was long enough to be annoyed by this poorly designed game. It was terrible.

Way WAY to close camera view, Your first character in the tutorial literally screams every time you have her move, incredibly  annoying. The ESC key does nothing, and the "back button" option is not in the same positions in the different menues, you also cannot control the camera with the keyboard, its hard to tell the difference between the selectable build options and the greyed out ones. Like who designed this thing, and did they intend to make it annoying to play? No thanks. I do not recommend this title.

review: Blatant rip off, copy cat & clone of Age of Empires, what makes this game different from AoE though? Its free, its worse, it has loot boxes and worthless digital trash called cosmetics. The tutorial skirmish took me nearly 90 minutes, i lost my main base and had to rebuilt in the lower corner which the AI allowed me to do and it never pulled back its army to defend the main city, so, suffice to say, this game or RTSes in general, arent for me, not anymore atleast, (i grew up on RTSes though, original C&Cs and Dune Battle For Arrakis, Warcraft 2 were my first ones, loved them, played them as a kid in the late 90s or early 2000s, dont remember.) or AoE and its clones, or... i dont know, im just bad at games, okay? Esspecialy any strategy one, the complex, the worse i do. So uh, if you somehow are stripped for cash, want to try out RTSes, and for NO REASON dont want to try out the free Command and Conquer titles from the website called Communications Centre....then...go for this i guess.... if you do have money though, buy the actual AoE & C&C games, not the ''defenitive'' versions though, the original ones, the actual good ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796334282', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1567101271}
review:
This is my own personal experience, might not be the same for you guys.

I was having problems the minute I started up the game. I don't know why the devs thought it was a good idea to put the graphics to Ultra as default, so I lowered it. Crashed immediately. Reloaded it, set it to low, froze again before it worked. Managed to complete the tutorial, barely, and was ready to play with my friends (the main reason I got the game in the first place).

I don't know about you, but I play games for fun. But what's the fun in getting disconnected time and time again from the same match for no less than an hour? My laptop can handle Star Conflict (a rather big game) War Thunder, Cosmoteer, Kingdoms and Castles, and other games without problems, but for some unknown reason, this game's optimisation is so bad that I can't even get a lick of entertainment and enjoyment out of the game.

All in all, if you're looking for a game that isn't too taxing on your low end computer, this game is not for you.

I'll give it a positive review once they've made a few updates to make the game playable for low end devices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332849567', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1566512131}
review:
Good parts:
- nice graphics
- in comparison to Age of Mythology, this game allows to select more units
- in comparison to Age of Mythology, each unit takes 1 unit space, so you can build a larger army
- ability to plan in advance - while the building is being built, you can alreayd select the upgrades that will be explored as soon as the building is complete

Bad parts:
- AI is stupid af. It took me 29 minutes to defeat Hard AI and 21 minute to defeat Hardest. For some reason, AI thinks that building 3 Town Centers, 20 houses and  then spamming farmers is better early in the game than making an army, upgrading it quickly and attacking first.
- No variation in development. In Age of mythology you could select different gods that gave you different powers and bonuses, so it kinda impacted your game, while here you just follow a single progression.
- Each time your farm expires, you need to "repair" it in order to use again. Weird and distracting
- A bit buggy. Sometimes farmer AI have trouble finding resources like trees etc. Sometimes they don't do the action from the 1st try
- Warrior AIs take 1 unit out of the crowd (not with the lowest HP) and the whole bunch of them then follows this one target. Would be better if this logic was improved and sophisticated a bit.
- No powers, no heroes (only 1 in fact).
- There are a lot of paid nations, although they are mechanically the same with some minor variations
- I have a feeling that devs took more time to diversify the game by add ing textures and models and integrating them as a system of chests, instead of acutally working on the game and making sure that it's interesting to play. Come on, textures in a strategy game? I can barely see that sword that a warrior is holding, I can't even notice the difference between the standard model and the one I got from a chest. 

It's a good start for a game. If you removed useless chests, made less nations, but made them more different, improved the AI and added something challenging, non-standard to the game, it would be a fun game to play. But at the moment it looks like an early access game. You concentrated a lot on progression and chests, while you should think more of adding diversity to the game and making it interesting to play for more than 1 evening.

review: Its basically a re-skin of age of empires 2, but this time to play different factions its been chopped up and sold separately from the base game. Other downfall is there only being 7 or so factions to pick from once purchased. Plus points is the AI are very good, and aggressive, they will rush you. I still dont understand the whole lootbox concept, its a strategy game! I still rate it a decent game, about 6 out of 10. Just a bigger fan of the AOE series, comparing to this online battler of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001357450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1565727681}
review:
In short, this game in terrible.

Why?

1) The game has been put behind a free-to-play scheme with lootboxes, because it was making no money being sold as an actual game.

2) The game is really buggy. You can set farmers to auto-seed (when the farm is depleted) but 9 times out of 10 they don't do it. It got very annoying, very fast.

3) Resource management is 90's style, where everything is depleted and resources don't seem to cover costs.

4) UL is unclear and confusing. Everything from menu selection to where to click to advance to the next "age" (that doesn't really exist here, it's more like an upgrade option) is unclear and I had a difficult time trying to find where to click.

5)  Units are extremely weak and will damage easily, against civilians (of all people).

6) Lack of game variety. For a game that used to be charged, if this is all that's available it's incredibly disapointing.

7) The artistic style is ugly, blocky and convuluted. Colours don't seem to blend together well so all the visual effects on the screen are overbearing.

In short, play Age of Empire definitive edition when it comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214739864', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1578799048}
review:
I've logged an awful lot of time into this game, and have recorded many different games that I have played, and I have to say, I am quite pleased with how the game plays compared to other games of this style.

Gameplay moves pretty quickly once you get going, but slow enough that it doesn't feel rushed. With a huge variety of units and civilizations, no two games feel the same. Each time you go to play, you can always expect something new.

One of the downsides however, is some of the simple little bugs. Like units getting stuck, or buildings not building, make the game a little frustrating at times, but it doesn't make the game unplayable by any means.

I would recommend this game to any player who has tried Age of Empires, as this is a great option if you're looking for a free-to-play option.
