author: {'steamid': '76561198200660294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1582395421}
review:
Edit: Unfortunately, the game has become unplayable with constant fatal errors.

So this game was exactly what I've been looking for since Age of Empires 3. It's a mixture of Age of Empires 3 gameplay, Age of Empires 2 and Civilization V UI in a low poly art style. It plays well and I didn't encounter any issues thus far. There are some areas that still might need some work, such as using keybinds/keys to use the UI (or at least open the game menu).

author: {'steamid': '76561198105791473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1563225492}
review:
Having played every Age of Empires game, including my favorite which was Age of Empires Online, I can say that Empires Apart has great potential, but lacks popularity which is detrimental to the game's growth in the long run. The graphics are simple, yet elegant and the gameplay can range from slow, turtle-like strategies to fast-paced assaults on the enemy base.

The new loot box system might seem a little confusing at first, but it functions exactly like Age of Empires Online's loot system worked; Any items gained from loot boxes, which you can earn by playing and leveling up, are cosmetic and can be applied to customize the look of your favorite civilizations. You want Byzantine spearmen to have a massive axe? Can do!

The sound design is good overall, but it sadly lacks anything that really knocks the game out of the park. The old games, namely Age of Mythology, had very memorable soundtracks which, despite them being almost or even more than a decade old, I can still fully remember because they were so catchy and well-designed. Whilst the sounds and music of Empires Apart are not lacking in quality, they are not something that will endlessly stick by you. A neat point, however, is that every civilization speaks their native tongue properly as far as I personally can tell.

Interface and hotkeys are a hot topic for debate on this game, and I have to agree with the critics on this one. Most if not all of us are used to the standard interface, GUI and hotkeys that the Age of Empires series, Starcraft and other RTS games use, so it might be prudent to follow the set formula in this regard and streamline it a little bit in line with what the critics say. I personally am not a keyboard warrior so I don't often use hotkeys or other macro's, I just like to take it easy and take everything in at my own pace, but that is just my experience.

Gameplay wise, the game works exactly as intended. Each civ has their strong and weak points, and the best part is that unlike Age of Empires 2, where every civilization had a shared tech tree, only with some unique techs of their own, in Empires Apart every civilization has their own unique playstyle to an extent. The Mongols, for example. play completely different from the Byzantines, and it offers a very unique experience. The AI, however, can sometimes be somewhat buggy, such as prioritizing the wrong targets, ignoring player troops that massacre theirs whilst their cavalry chase down villagers into a fortified base, et cetera. These bugs are not extremely obvious, but they should nonetheless be addressed. Finally, the greatest point of contention for me is that formations don't always work well and units can get stuck in places until you manually move them out of the chokepoint they are stuck in. Nonetheless, this game is very entertaining and great to look at.

Some nitpicks of mine that I had:

-The day/night cycle can be very abrupt, and it is somewhat disorienting to suddenly have to work in the dark. My suggestion is to make this transition somewhat smoother to ease the contrast between day and night.

-No map editor. I realise from conversations on the forums here and around the game's pages that the devs are still hard at work and it is relatively difficult to introduce such grand new features, but I think it's vital that a map editor/scenario creator be implemented to let the community design it's own maps, scenarios and possibly campaigns.

-No campaigns or scenarios. As mentioned in my last point, one of the greatest joys of the Age of Empires series was that they offered scenarios and campaigns that told the stories of famous events in history, with you as the player re-enacting them. These singleplayer experiences really enriched the game and made it much more fun to play alone when you didn't play online. I'm looking forward to maybe playing something akin to that in this game somewhere in the future.

-The biggest problem with the game, as mentioned at the very start of this review, is that the playerbase is small compared to other games. Empires Apart may be considered an in-development game, but if the game wants to grow, there needs to be made more publicity to get people interested in the game and convince them to play.

To sum the entire thing up with a bow on top, I'd say Empires Apart is not Age of Empires. The two are very much alike, yet different in many ways and Empires Apart has the potential to offer some fine and unique experiences, provided the devs keep working and doing their best on improving the game. Considering the game isn't made by some huge developer, I'm confident in saying that the quality of the game in relation to the resources used for making it is really good. I definitely recommend playing this, especially now that the game is essentially free to play.

Last but not least, as a message directly to the developers: Loot boxes have left a sour taste in the mouths of many gamers. I understand that the system you're using is purely for cosmetics and not actually any tangible advantages in-game, but you might want to try to rebrand the whole thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065960859', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1562695827}
review:
This feels like the Empires game Ive wanted. 
it has the core strategic gameplay down,it runs pretty well,The main menu is a bit odd,but dont let that put you off the fact that this game has big potential and is currently enjoyable to play,as long as it keeps its originality during the course of its development I can see this game being a big success,its a gem. Give it a try and im certain you will enjoy this game. 

Building a base and army from start to finish is satisfying. 
The graphics are decent although the environments could look a bit better.
Overall combat is enjoyable,ai is a little broken.but manages to keep me happy 99% of the time.
Could benefit with better servers,more buildings and a graphics upgrade.
has a decent skill tree,civilisation and economy trees
army/combat management is lacking but the basics do well

Is a good game and I enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139802126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1589404172}
review: As someone who played RTS's for a while, this is definitely a simplistic but modern take on the genre. It is similar to AOE but less complex. However, I wouldn't say it feels "mobile" as others are saying. Rather, it is a different take which is more fast paced. I personally enjoy this game, and even though its free it feels complete. For a free game, this is definitely worth a try, since if you like it it will take up a lot of time. HOWEVER, make sure that if you plan to play online you have friends, otherwise the game is pretty empty right now. Luckily there is singleplayer to balance things out though.

review:
If you like the Age of Empires games, then you might find this an ok game.
Building the base, fighting and harvesting resources should be easy when you've played any of the classic rts games like c&c, dune II, warcraft or AoE.
The fighting hower leaves a bit of a bad taste. There is no feeling of impact when the units do damage and this makes the combat a bit dull.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999193203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1561532080}
review:
This game is an Age of Empires 2 rip off.  And it's bad at doing so too. However just because it looked like AOE2 from the store page, I gave it a try.

And oh boy, I'm laughing at all these people in the reviews whom call this game "good" and I'll tell you why;

- The mini-map is at the top of the screen and that's painful as there is apparently no way to move it in the UI. Every RTS or MOBA has it's mini-map either at the bottom left or bottom right corner and modern games allow you to change where the mini-map is. It's a thing that has been ground in for decades and our veteran-player-eye-movement is used to this.

- While at first the graphics look "smooth", they are infact horrendous, once you've started playing, as you have no clear distinction between units because of the lack of detail. It's like they were going after Team Fortress 2 meets AOE2 as a graphics style / colour palette but failed by discarding any form of detail and unit distinction.

- Claims itself F2P but hides all of it's civilizations behind a paywall and so you can only play 1 civilization.

edit: spelling mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138133847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1615840696}
review:
If you own Age of Empires there is absolutely no reason to play this game.  It is Age of Empires, but worse.  Age of Empires 2 is actually cheaper when you consider each army is 5 dollars each.

Examples of annoyance is the decided change of the universal button of escape.  Escape does nothing and while you can rebind the pause menu you can't rebind it to escape because escape in the rebind menu cancels the bind.  Instead the button for pause is all the way on the other side of the keyboard F10.  It is frustrating to be playing a game and want to pause or change some settings and hit the escape button.  Nothing happens.  Hit it again.  Nothing happens.  This is when you get frustrated and start spamming it before remembering, "Oh yeah that is right the developers decided to change it for some stupid reason".  This is not a big issue on the grand scheme of things but it is showing a disregard for standardized systems for their own.  It is enough for me to say "Fuck this game".

Another bad thing is customization.  You can customize your soldiers and some of your buildings.  "Well that doesn't sound too bad what is the catch?" it is based on a loot box system.  I don't mind having to pay for the armies.  I do mind when game developers charge money to gamble.  Thank god there are people making steps to make that horrific toxin out of games but in the mean time there will be games that exploit the addictive nature of humans to make money.  Being "free to play" isn't an argument for a dirty microtransaction system.

Finally there is the single player.  I personally am not someone that likes to play RTS games against other players.  I am not too keen on micro managing units and would prefer to relax while fighting bots with friends.  I don't want to fight friends because being taken out of the game or taking a friend out of the game is just not fun.  With bots you could only have a maximum of 1 bot before the game plummets down to 10 FPS no matter the graphics setting later in the game.  It is atrocious.  Then there is the challenges which are either easy or require a specific timing based strategy and at the best of times is dull and boring and at the worst makes you want to uninstall you computer from the Milky Way.

review: Il gioco √® carino e il fatto che sia fatto da italiani gli fa onore. Ci sono due pecche a mio avviso: la prima √® che molti edifici, giocando con i bizantini (√® la civilt√† gratuita con cui parti), non sono immediatamente riconoscibili, un po' si assomigliano, sar√† per il colori uguali, ma non sono distinguibili immediatamente (almeno quelli per produrre unit√†) a meno che tu non abbia fatto diverse partite o tu li abbia raggruppati vicini; la seconda √® che, almeno per le partite contro la IA, non ci sia la capacit√† di ridurre il tempo almeno per farti prendere fiato, ma alla fine questo gioco si rispecchia in Age of Empire.

-Free-to-play: si possiede una fazione iniziale gratis (Bizantini) e le altre si possono acquistare tramite dlc abbordabili (3.90 circa a fazione) Inoltre tutte le fazioni si possono provare a dovere prima dell'eventuale acquisto. Sono presenti inoltre le classiche casse da aprire che danno comunque solo skin e oggetti estetici. No pay-to-win.
-Diverse modalit√† (pvp,pve,survival,sfide,..)
-Si pu√≤ giocare con un amico contro l'IA
-Creatori italiani che √® una rarit√†

CONTRO:
-Combattimenti un po' troppo veloci
-Alcuni bug dell'I.A.
-Sembra non essere pi√π aggiornato

CONCLUSIONE:
Consiglio questo gioco a tutti gli amanti degli RTS vecchio stile. Il gioco riesce ad essere godibile ed interessante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192951751', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1687967080}
review:
its simple .. 
if u have friends to play with in this game .. you will have fun
but if no .. you gonna hate this game and uninstall it after few matches
i feel this game unbalanced
like if u played FULL deff with so many fortunes .. a full army with 300 unit cant even defeat you ..
but if u play with friends at least u can make a deal and rules in the match and have fun like not allowing your friend to attack you until the armies are completed etc ..
so in my opinion .. i enjoyed this game cuz i have friends to play with
and the graphics are good and the soundtracks are amazing also the game play and the HUD etc ..
its like an AOE II but a smoother .. but still .. its unbalanced and there an other option .. so i dont recommend this game "for now"

author: {'steamid': '76561198134629942', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2001, 'last_played': 1690782621}
review:
Great game, more diverse than Age of Empires 2, waiting for more content.
Pros

Farm Auto-Reseeding
One General Deposit
Modern UI and graphics.
Civilizations are more diverse
Wonderful Soundtrack

Cons
Have to buy/earn civilizations
No campaign
AI is not perfect
Smaller Playerbase (I can still find games on a consistent basis.)

Overall, I think this is a superior form of Age of Empires 2, and would recommends this to any one who enjoys strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077057581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1633956957}
review:
I creatori sono italiani e devo dire di esserne molto fiero, visto il parco titoli praticamente inesistente (soprattutto se si parla di qualit√†)! 
Il gioco in compagnia √® piacevole e simpatico, preso da soli potrebbe stancare un p√≤ facilmente per la sua struttura (almeno per ora) molto da "Accesso Anticipato".

-Musiche: Le musiche sono belle e spesso, e trasmettono il giusto per ogni fazione.. forse solo un p√≤ ripetitive a volte, e peccano di non essere contenstuali, ovvero: Quando state costruendo di solito nei giochi RTS c'√® un sound tranquillo e quando ti attaccano magari parte un brano pi√π movimentato. Le prime volte all'ascolto devo ammettere di essermi scagazzato pensando mi stessero attaccando, quando invece era andata avanti la "playlist".

-IA: Medio scarsina per certi versi, e uber power per altri. Si incastreranno spesso i mercanti  e i vari soldati, costringendo a volte di spostare le unit√† in blocchi, specialmente in luoghi stretti.

-DLC: Purtroppo anche qui i DLC regnano, ma i prezzi non sono assurdissimi almeno..come fa invece la serie TotalWar.
√® presente uno shop all'interno del gioco che ci far√† shoppare tramite le classiche casse con ricompense casuali, o specifici set di casse a tema per ogni fazione. Le casse possono essere acquistate o vinte giocando e salendo di livello e sbloccando alcuni obiettivi. Tranquilli niente PayToWin, dato che si possono solo trovare oggetti cosmetici o diverse skin per armi, armature, elmi, edifici, loghi, bandiere ecc. Contando che ogni fazione ha il suo carattere, la sua identit√†, sue musiche dedicate e il suo "doppiaggio" direi che il prezzo ci pu√≤ anche stare.

-Fazioni: Le fazioni non sono n√® tante, n√® troppe, ci sta per ora. Ogni fazione ha le sue strutture, le sue unit√† differenti, e i suoi eroi con le loro abilit√† specifiche. Direi bilanciato sommariamente bene il tutto (per ora), ma si ha un p√≤ la sensazione che cambi in fondo solo la skin alla fazione a volte..e non che ci siano effettivamente due fazioni differenti a confronto. Le musiche relative ad ogni fazione sono molto piacevoli ed ispirate (a parte 1 o 2), non banali come molti stressano nelle recensioni.

-Grafica: E' molto stuzzichevole, minimale e fa il suo. Ottimizzato, per ora, malino.. a volte, spesso dinanzi a molte unit√† si va a scatti un pochino ma di certo non da sembrare un album fotografico come No Man's Sky il primo anno di vita.
Poligoni quanti ne bastano. Risulta davvero molto rilassante, senza avere 900 dettagli incredibili a sfiancarti la cornea.
Colori tiepidi e azzeccati, tranne qualche (credo) "evento atmosferico" riuscito un p√≤ malino, come delle simil "tempeste di sabbia/foschia" che ti fanno un p√≤ sforzare l'occhio, ma niente di troppo pesante.

-Unit√†: Ogni fazione ha le sue buone caratteristiche estetiche, sia nell'esercito sia negli edifici. Le statistiche non so ancora se cambino molto di fazione in fazione, mi sembra tutto abbastanza equilibrato a parte qualche arma/abilit√† speciale.
Le animazioni, buone in alcuni casi e molto povere in altri..soprattutto negli scontri. Spesso non sembra stiano dando una "spadata", sembra stiano dando uno scapelotto sulla nuca tipo "Hai fatto i compiti vero?!?!". Le unit√† si compenetrano che √® un "piacere", quindi potrete vedere negli spazi stretti, degli specie di millepiedi con cavalli, arcieri,lancieri,baliste,argani tutti assieme uniti in una stessa entit√† senziente, ma dopotutto succede nel 90% di questo tipo di giochi.

-Gameplay: Ovviamente pi√π stimolante e divertente in compagnia. Per ora ci sono solo qualche sfida molto meh, le classiche partite online, le partite da solo contro i bot o con amici contro i bot, o contro gli amici ecc ecc. Ho potuto provare seriamente solo la prima fazione, i Bizantini, in quanto unica scelta disponibile nel FreeToPlay. Le altre fazioni sono testabili in una buona modalit√† "prova" dove vi cimenteranno in uno scenario con una mappa ristretta, tutte le unit√† potenziate al massimo del loro splendore ed efficienza e tutti gli edifici disponibili... poi vi faranno assediare una fazione per testare tutte le unit√† in combattimento (Devo ammettere  che √® la miglior modalit√† Prova/Dimostrazione che abbia mai visto in giochi di questo tipo. Dato che spesso manca proprio o se c'√®, √® un video o qualcosa di molto deludente). Quindi vi fanno assaggiare un p√≤ le fazioni in DLC, e non √® cosa da tutti..anzi.. (vero Total War??VERO??!!). Le mappe al momento non sono molte, ma carine, design morbido e adatto ai biomi selezionati, ma si pu√≤ fare di pi√π dai.
I combattimenti forse sono un p√≤ troppo rapidi.. passate 1 ora a fare e sudare i vostri uomini e li vedete spegnersi in "un attimo" se la battaglia volge a vostro sfavore. Limite di unit√† per ora a 300 unit√†, e devo dire che ci sta, rispetto a molti altri RTS, ci sta..non √® cosi limitativo. Diciamo che ci si annienta molto prima dei 200 molto spesso.


Il gioco √® FreeToPlay ed √® una bella scoperta, nonostante sia ritornato diverse volte sulla pagina di Steam per vedere se fosse in accesso anticipato, a causa di alcuni fatti di "pochezza/inconsistenza" di alcune cose che si percepiscono giocando.
Il titolo merita sicuramente, √® ispirato, con un buon lavoro dietro pu√≤ avere una sua identit√† (che ha gi√† in parte) ancora pi√π pronunciata ed incisiva. Voglio incoraggiare il Team di sviluppo italiano a migliorare questo titolo, perch√® seriamente pu√≤ ritagliarsi il SUO pubblico, dando qualche colpo deciso e ben pensato di pennello. Arricchite con fazioni e idee, o migliorate ci√≤ che gi√† esiste, poich√® ci sia sempre di pi√π giocando la sensazione di Solidit√†, che alcune volte, almeno io, risento.

Comprer√≤ qualche DLC sicuramente, poich√® intrigato e volenteroso di supportare il Team Italiano!

Come dice Ren√® Ferretti:  << Dai Dai Dai!! >>

author: {'steamid': '76561198799655726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1557857879}
review: I just got this game yesterday and I've already played 4 hours of it. By the end of the week, I'll have more. I do like this game. For free, it is one of the best RTS games I've played. Emphasis on "FREE RTS". I will say that it is clearly a Age of Empires ripoff. Having played AoE for more hours than I can count, it reeks of AoE. The controls are the same, a lot of the functions are the same, and some of the gameplay is straight ctrl-c. BUT, that being said, it can actually stand on its own against AoE. You can't play as many cultures, but there are different ones. You can't have as many maps, but you can customize your gameplay more. And you don't have to have an Alienware to run decent graphics. It lacks some more interesting features of a usual RTS, but makes up for it with some unique things like the gear for different units and the chests. Overall, anyone who as ever played the AoE games and liked them will like this one. And even if you just are a fan of RTSs, this isn't a bad one. Don't expect the greatest of strategies tho. A fun game to come back to every once in a while. Oh, and it's free, so there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310084322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1555706244}
review:
I followed development of this game from almost the start.

What i hoped for is Age of empires like game.
What i don't like, they copied Age of empires, and made it worse... 
Literally reskined Age of empires with numbers changed.

If they only focused on making a good game, instead of trying to copy a game.
I think this game could be good, cause there is allot of effort put intro this game it's visible.

They copied Age of empires to EXTREME details and the core mechanics are wonky AF.
Stuttering units, GUI / UI is hard to learn, In combat units path questionably.

Some thing's that where fixed/solved two decades ago in RTS genre are present in this game.
Even Starcraft2 Recreation of Age of empires "Age of Knights" is better then this game, which is sad to make such statement.

review:

review: I have been looking for the perfect RTS for my taste for a really long time, and I think I found it. A lot of gameplay elements are similar to Age of Empires, but with modernized controls and sleek interface. On top of that, each civilization has its own unique mechanics and units and feel very different from each other. I cannot recommend this game enough. The community is small but I haven't had too many problems finding ladder games most days. And it's free, so it isn't hard to  try :)

review: With the new update who add level to your profil , loot chest and quest on a daily basis. A great upgrade to the game. There some bug who happen not frequently but overall its sharp. Minimalist graphics look beautiful and runs smootly. Fan of RTS like AoE or W3 will enjoy this game . author: {'steamid': '76561198211192995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1548802225}
review: Good traditional RTS game, since going free to play the game has stabilised a lot and has grown an acceptable playerbase to find games with. Similar to Age of Empires but brought into the modern age with better controls, faster game flow and unique factions. No campaign for you single player folks but as a multiplayer game it is one of the best modern RTS, certainly coming from such a small indie team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085750275', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2285, 'last_played': 1568767288}
review:
A good addition to any RTS fan's library - no excuse not to try, it is free!

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Age of Empires style core gameplay
[*]Several asymmetric factions with really cool mechanics (Byzantines/French/Chinese/Arabs/Mongols/Aztecs/Koreans)
[*]Modern UI and controls
[*]Randomly generated maps
[*]Spectator mode
[*]Responsive units
[*]King of the Hill mode
[*]Survival mode
[*]Challenge levels
[*]Skirmish vs AI
[*]Matchmaking, leagues and ladders
[*]Microtransactions are purely cosmetic and faction unlocks. 
[*]You do not need to pay a dime if you have the patience to unlock everything via leveling rewards.
[/list]
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]No campaign at the time of this review
[*]No replays
[*]Some of the maps are too choke pointy
[*]Naval unit roster has no real sophistication - not on par in its design when compared with land units
[*]A few modern controls are not implemented yet
[*]Rare desyncs still occur
[*]No dedicated servers
[*]No in game leaderboards
[/list]
Overall, in the current state, I'd give the game a 7/10. Will update my review  if there are major updates or if these negative points are addressed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082455031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1554036804}
review:
Rating: 3 of 10

AOE clone, graphics and music is great, the core mechanics seems okay, but the game itself is shallow with only a handfull of units, upgrades and small tech tree, it feels like a Tablet/Mobile clone with it's shallow zoom, not being able to see your playing properly is a serious irritation, but the worst thing is the stupid loot crates, pointless skins and nations you have to purchase to have any "fun".

Empires Apart could be great, i would not mind paying 20,- USD for it, if they fixed the issues above, i has to matches the level of content you and depth you get with the old classics.

don't spend you time playing this title, if you can't wait for another AOE like RTS do have a look at the open source project called 0.AD

author: {'steamid': '76561198155736100', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1614482734}
review:
-Los requisitos m√≠nimos no son correctos almenos en el procesador, pide un Intel Core i5 como m√≠nimo pero yo uso un i3 y me corre perfectamente fluido a m√°xima poblaci√≥n con gr√°ficos al m√°ximo y grabando en HD-

Recomendado tanto para jugadores dedicados como para jugadores mas casuales, gracias a su jugabilidad diferente a cualquier AOE.

Un punto muy positivo es que los desarrolladores escuchan mucho a la comunidad, quieren hacer de empires apart un juego dedicado para los esports a diferencia de los AOE.

Las facciones que son de pago no son caras ($55 Mexicanos) y se pueden conseguir gratuitamente jugando.
Destaco que No es un Pay2Win, nada que ver, pero si puede cambiar radicalmente tu forma de juego, completamente normal y se agradece (Amplifica las posibilidades).

No es complicado ganarle a la IA (punto negativo), pero al final de cuentas, lo que importa son las partidas contra otros jugadores Online.

Hasta el momento no he visto ni un Bug que pueda afectar mucho inGame a diferencia de otros juegos llenos de bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026099719', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1554138139}
review:
I just took a sneak peak into the game but all what I can say is: This game is great! Sure, there are some problems here and there. But all in all it's a classic RTS with enough depth to it and it plays very smooth.

I hope the development team will roll out a good marketing campaign after they polish the game and added a few more civs (Japanese, Wikings, Teutons?). Because the game needs more attention. I also kinda like the cosmetics. It adds the current trend of "making progress" to a RTS. It's nothing you really need but anyway: Cool idea!

I will play a few more games with the free civ. Right now I can't decide which civ I want to train. But maybe, there is the next one about to release right after the corner. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198376479253', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1552775407}
review:
Pros:

>Free-to-play.
>Very unique graphical art style.
>Above average RTS elements.
>Unit control elements well done.
>Each faction has their own unique gameplay elements.

Cons:

>Brings not a whole lot of new or unique aspects to the genre.
>Limited single player aspect due to lack of a campaign or story mode.
>Limited multiplayer aspect due to playerbase.
>Very small player base with an average of less than 150 players.
>Some technical problems.

An above average free-to-play RTS that is based on the old school RTS games.
If a fan of old school RTS games it should be worth at least a try, 
however be warned it is not as polished or good as them.
It is currently very early in developmental stage and many 
features can be changed, added or removed.

Overall I give it a 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109339807', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1552835079}
review:
Empire Apart non sarebbe male come titolo, ma a differenza di altri titoli simili non regge il confronto.
Troppi difetti che ho scoperto giocando mi hanno fatto ricredere, ed ero partito con positivit√†.

PREGI
- Grafica semplice.
- Unit√†, edifici e caratteristiche di ogni civilt√† differenti e varie.
- Ripresa di un genere di gioco lasciato un p√≤ in disparte.

DIFETTI
- Sovrapposizione dei testi degli obiettivi con le icone del marcato.
- Ripetivit√† dei suoni delle unit√† che con troppi click risultano fastidiose.
- Posizionamento delle unit√† militari alquanto scadente, le unit√† si intralciano a vicenda.
- Calcolo dei danni sbilanciato, in una partita una trentina di popolani hanno sterminato fanteria e cavalleria come niente.
- IA molto scarsa, risulta pi√π intelligente quella di Empire Earth 2 nella modalit√† pi√π scarsa selezionabile.
- SOLO una civilt√† utilizzabile senza pagare nulla, per le skin ci pu√≤ anche stare, ma le civilit√† no; sarebbe stato gradita quanto meno la scelta della civilt√† da poter usare.

Spero vivamente che gli sviluppatori facciano un p√≤ di ordine nei loro intenti e migliorino il titolo.

Why? It is mindless fun, it is fleshed out and fun. It is satisfying to build an army and conquer the world. Give it a shot, I mean it is free

review:
101 horas no beta.
30 minutos agora no Free to Play.

Fiquei muito feliz que agora ele ficou free to play, gostei muito desse jogo no beta e finalmente corrigiram o bug que dava no mouse. ele teve MUITAS mudan√ßas, ganhou estat√≠sticas, avatares, miss√µes di√°rias, sistema de progress√£o(level), modo online ranqueado e novos modos de jogo. colocaram um sistema de lootbox e inventario na steam, tamb√©m colocaram DLCs com civiliza√ß√µes o que achei bem feioso. N√£o tive problemas de fps com muitas tropas na tela como algumas pessoas est√£o tendo.

Finalizando, √© um Age of Empires com textura low poly, com alguns modos de jogo novos, perfil de jogadores e quadro de estat√≠sticas. Sinceramente nada novo me importou muito, eu s√≥ jogo o single-player igual no Age of Empires.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198045666', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1612043594}
review:
i love the game. I just dislike how the camera i locked in one direction. I'd like to be able to change the position of a camera to do different things. Other than that its a good game 

ignore the above review. Updated as of the 30th of January 2021.

Came back to this game after a long whiles and the game feels more like a cheap mobile game which has been knocked out than a fully fledged pc RTS. The tutorial takes far too long and isn't very informative as to what to do (both my fiance and i both did the tutorial and we got bored)

The graphics are charmingly simplistic which is nice! However the amount of small dlc purchased for each different civilisation is ridiculous. Although the games description says.... 

An exciting free-to-play Real Time Strategy game set in medieval times. Uniquely designed factions, customization options, singleplayer and multiplayer gameplay. Gather resources, raise an army and lead your civilization to victory in a classic RTS, brought to the modern age...

feels more like a boring slow paced game with an ai about as smart as a rock, especially on the island map with only access to a single faction! They expect you to pay for the rest!! On top of the empires chest which are priced at 75p for 1!! Just 1!!! Its ridiculously overpriced! Alongside the cost of just under ¬£4 per different civilisation coming to the grand total of ¬£30 for a "free to play" game. A free to play game that is going to be killed by the greed of the publishers for charging such extortionate amounts for such little return.

Gaming is becoming and excessively expensive hobby so i'd recommend saving your hours for other games that might cost! But atleast not as much as this bs

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1551204448}
review:
Empires Apart is basically Age of Empires I free. For those who are not familiar with the Age of Empires series, I would recommend that you Google it up. It should be a classic real time strategy game. The objective of the Empires Apart is to destroy all your enemies Town Centres.

Gameplay-wise, mouse and keyboard hotkeys. There's a different key for Auto-attack, instead of A, it's Q. 

Generally, it's the same as Age of Empires. Build a large number of villagers to collect resources, namely Food, Wood, Gold and Stone. Build Economic, Miliitary and Defense buildings. Instead of leveling up the Age, you upgrade the Civil or Economic side of your Empire. 

Conclusion, there's really nothing special since this is a clone of Age of Empires. However, it's free. This is Empires Apart's greatest selling point. 

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Not Sure
I thought it was free but they only gave you 1 out of the 7 Empires instead of all of them.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Nothing Special
It's an exact copy of Age of Empires 2.

review: Empires Apart is simpler than most other RTS-Games, but still requires you to multitask quite a lot of things. I am playing it with a friend of mine and we are having tons of fun, even though we have very different expectations of RTS games. We are already planning on purchasing other civilizations as they differ in their outer appearance but also in their playstyle. When it comes to the performance of the game, i feel like its not optimized that well, what is a problem for my friend especially. He suffers from low fps counts even though this game only has this low poly grafics that is meant to be ressource saving. In conclusion I would still recommend you to try this game if u like the genre. As it is f2p u cant do anything wrong with it anyways

author: {'steamid': '76561197970659761', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1561818019}
review:
It's basically a modern version of Age of Empires, although that's a pretty obvious observation.

I'm finding it pretty difficult, but that could just be that my RTS skills are rusty.

There are some bugs, but it looks like the game's still being actively supported so I assume they'll get fixed at some point.

I was a bit worried about the F2P pivot, but being able to try it out for free and buy civilizations one at a time is actually pretty nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158999472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1550784450}
review:
Needs work. I tried the tutorial and i can already tell this is Age of empires 2 with heroes that have a special ability(Which is NOT neat if you ask me). The color is very monotone and is depressing to look at. And the graphics look like it would please mobile peasants. At first glance it seemed like it would be the forgotten version of Age of Empires that Microsoft once hosted 
called "Age of Empires Online" which i must say would have been a better goal for development because that game is closed while Age of empires 2 still lives on.

But it plays nicely and runs smooth that i can give the developer.

review:
EDIT: DO NOT TRY THIS GAME - it will give you 32 untradeble inventory items that you CAN NOT get rid of.. its like they punish you for giving them a chance

WOW this game is the worst Age of Empires 2 Clone i have seen so far.
Auto rebuld of farms? nope did not find it. have fun redoing your 20 farms every 4 minutes
trebuches (endgame siege weapons) havo to pack and unpack, but the unit while packing/unpacking is bigger than in the finished state. a dear ran next to my unpacked siege weapon and i could not pack it.... 
graphic style makes it all look the same...
units on an "attack in range move order" stopped half way to the destination...
3 times i quickly selected my village center and made a rally point BUT it selected a house half a sereen away... 
and this was just the toturial skirmish

author: {'steamid': '76561198370725980', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1592682231}
review:
I really enjoyed first  30 minutes of playing this game, even a great tutorial!! I thought it'll be just another Indie strategy game ... but after every step , what tutorial gave me, i said, holy shit ! This game is cool (I'am also playing on ultra*) , i have to write a review.

[b]Positive[/b]
+ Good quality
+Fun
+Tutorial that helps you to learn a game basics
+Ranked system

[b]Negative[/b]
-over 4euros  for different clan bundles
-i can see shit at night 

I'll recommend this to all Strategy lovers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057696873', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1710607288}
review:
A good Age of empires Online take on. You have unit customisation and several game mods and maps. I hope they will add co-op to Survival mod, that would be great. 
I think the game shouldn't be free to play with dlc civilizations, but for classic price after development is done. First the game should take up more players.
PS: I know it's in tips, but lot of people asked me in game anyway. You can create game with bots if you set your game instead of 1v1 etc. to Open.
Also the points in King of the Hill should be raised, we've just built a defences and it was over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258062878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1618852399}
review: Good game, BUT there are several things which need to be fixed. First, the AI is completely trash. It doesn't manage to stay in their borders, They just suddenly start to build directly in front of you. They build masses of houses with no use. Later, in Game Statistics, they didn't even use a quarter of it. They attack you suddenly while your neutral to them. You forge an alliance with them, just to see seconds later they declared war to you. And then, just few seconds later again, they want an alliance. And again, they declare war etc.... Second, ships are bugging on Island Map. Just a little Problem, but it is there. Third, if your neutral to another Player/AI, your Soldiers still attack them, which leads to war in few seconds. And last, even with a good computer you sometimes have performance problems. Please fix it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198337671655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1557438705}
review:
Ottimizzato davvero male; dopo un p√≤ diventa ingiocabile per il lag. Si ispira al pi√π famoso Age of Empires (con grafica decisamente pi√π accattivante bench√® abbia quasi 15 anni) con qualche meccanica in meno e una castrata scelta di evoluzione della tua civilt√†. Sarei stato pi√π che contento di supportare questo gioco, comprando i diversi pacchetti che offrono, aspettavo da tempo uno strategico stile Age of, soprattutto da una casa sviluppatrice italiana, ma purtroppo la cattiva ottimizzazione lo rende ingiocabile anche su un pc di fascia media (scheda grafica GTX950).
Mi auguro rilascino nuovi aggiornamenti per migliorarlo, ma per ora √® un deciso NO

P.s. se invece possedete una Titan-X; non riuscite a stressarla con Crysis III ad ultra, e siete stufi di  quei noiosi 60 fps, allora questo √® il gioco che fa per voi! (consigliato a chi farma Bitcoin)

review: Age of Empires throwback is awesome, could use more fleshing out of units, buildings, and unique abilities.  Overall, is a great game with lots of future potential. author: {'steamid': '76561198028277659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1555413727}
review:
As a long time AOE II fan and player I find the game pretty interesting.
The game has unique civ concepts, hero systems and is much faster paced than Aoe2.
It obviously still has its flaws in balancing and mechanics but is getting better with every patch.
Also the Devs are open to discussion on the Discord servers about balacing and take suggestions into account.
Hopefully the playerbase and the competetive scene will increase in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017283413', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1546467387}
review:
I'm sorry guys... I really wanted to play and enjoy this one but i'm not having fun..

Recommended Yes for F2P
Not recommended because I paid for this game and ''will get access to exclusive content in the future'' doesnt work for me. 

Bonus: The survival game mode is a great feature but since maps are ''coming soon'' since release, i've given up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327930335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1553134794}
review:
pretty simple, the game is awesome, has all the features that we all know and love about those epic Classic RTS games we had, but a better gameplay. simpler but keeping the important elements of the historical RTS games, easier to learn and master. i liked those simplified techs they are better than trashy ones where you have to study them to know what they do while the icons and the simple  discription gives you the idea of what you about to do to get what you need first. i also liked the simple but beautiful graphics, well diversed civs but need more.

if i have a complaint about this game i would say that the scale isn't too large where the biggest pop cap is 300 and tbh we're in 2019 now and our pc's can handle a free pop cap where you can build as many houses\city centers as you want to increase your pop cap or at least make the pop cap 2000 or sth. 

having the game being free to play with only one civ available is totally fine with me since buying the other civs can be like buying the game to keep it forever after trying it. i even hope they add more civs in the future 

i was able to get my first Multiplayer ranked match after finishing my first skirmish game so you could say the multiplayer is really decent 
i got only a few hours in so i need to play more to say more, but for now
You should Give this game a try! it's really worth it you won't regret it and you got nothing to loose
and maybe get the other civs later on ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198156525668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1547491021}
review:
beside all the lags and bugs other players mentioned; you must be freaking kidding to have korean civ before other civs. unless you include plastic surguries, kim jong un's nuclear weapons and noise production, there's no way to make korean civ before other civs. 

let's be realistic, korean's historical military strength is just a joke, did they ever have any military success in foreign land outside their little peninsular?
Brits, Maya, Inca, German etc all deserve more than that no-military-influence country.

another asian civ which deserves to be in the game? does samurai & ninja ring a bell?

there's no reason to ditch aoe for this, lack of civs & poor civ-including decision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139349167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1555592334}
review:
Good fun, and visually stunning. I don't understand the complaints for the loot boxes since it's just cosmetics? This is a free to play game and they have to make money somehow. I wish the Civs were cheaper, but if they add more the bundle for all of them will become better value but as it stands they seem a little too costly.

This is essentially a simplified AoE clone with great graphics. Really fun game and theres a couple of game modes to play against AI and obiously multiplayer.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198117944993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1547129138}
review:
I haven't tried the multiplayer mode. I haven't played the game long enough.

Empire Apart is an "old school empire" RTS game with "modern graphic". I would say it has interesting graphic style. It is not something very realistic but still nice to see . Gameplay wise it is pretty much just "old school empire". It does feel have something new with some unit have active skill but not much.

Pros
+ good interesting graphic for this kind of game
+ I like empire game
+ have some translations
+ have settings specially custom graphic settings
+ have a tutorial
+ low requirements? i can see the resource difference between low quality and high quality
+ free to play?

Cons
- free to test with only 1 civilization
- interesting business strategy
- how to get fragment? what is the chance?
- repetitive bgm

author: {'steamid': '76561198031737271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1546541570}
review:
Has some awesome potential - I've enjoyed myself so far.  Very similar to AOE and others - but I like the graphic style more than I thought I would initially.

Here are some tweaks I recommend the devs look into:

1) AI - often runs through armies an dies without attacking
2) Walls - AI has yet to use them that I've seen - would be kinda neat if they would/could
3) Upgraded unit skins look too similar to previous versions
4) On a map with 7 AI - at 300 cap - game tends to become choppy at the end - not a huge deal and somewhat expected
5) AI overproduces fishing ships
6) Allow walls to extend to water's edge to prevent passage
7) Combat sounds are somewhat lackluster
8) Would be nice to start with 2 civilizations (I don't mind the gating) - but it seems like it will take a while to unlock a 2nd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077941920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1660757475}
review:
Da un p√≤ ho trovato un gioco davvero figo!
Si chiama "Empires Apart" e ricorda il gioco Warcraft.

Grafica 8/10
A me piacciono molto i giochi con la grafica cartonizzata, le ombre sono molto carine e le animazioni sono fantastiche!

Framerate 7/10
Il framerate √® stabile, quasi sempre.
Tranne nei momenti in cui si creano eserciti da 300 soldati pronti a distruggere il regno nemico xD

Contenuti 8/10
La vastit√† di edifici √® tantissima ei soldati sono un sacco!

Lo consiglio vivamente a tutti!
(Ed √® pure gratis :P)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062561570', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1546506865}
review:
Even though its an AOE rip off, I still wanted to give it a try.

The AI is so stupid, it will spam rush units at random resource gathering buildings while running past and getting slaughtered by your troops and towers..... My 8 year old nephew uses more advanced tactics than the AI in this game.

Multiplayer is also dead which leaves nothing further to do in this game.

Rather buy the remastered version of AOE 2.

review:
A fun game with much potential.
Even though it has a lot of similar features as AOE series and AOM, but the art style is refreshing and a slower game pace makes it enjoyable to play with friend.
It would be great to have a coop mode where custom matches could add in AI opponent.
Looking forward for the updates in the future.

review:

I don't mind the F2P model though I wish I had bought it before it went F2P but the fact you can buy factions and that is the only impactful purchase I've seen so far with the rest being cosmetics is fine in my book. O game apresenta uma √≥tima mecanica de batalhas e constru√ß√£o, porem o game apresenta alguns bugs como npcs girando e problemas de desempenho, o game pode parecer leve, mas basta colocar 100 soldados na tela que come√ßa a batalha contra o fps, Recomendo o jogo pra quem gosta do melhor estilo RTS, possui muitas personaliza√ß√µes de civiliza√ß√£o como armaduras, espadas, machados, bandeiras e muito mais, o jogo √© gratuito mas voc√™ come√ßa apenas com uma civiliza√ß√£o, podendo adiquirir outras comprando-as na loja, as civiliza√ß√µes podem tamb√©m ser desbloqueadas gratuitamente com os baus que o jogo dropa, quando voc√™ os abre ganha itens e tem achance de ganhar fragmentos de civiliza√ß√£o, que podem ser usados para desbloquear outras civiliza√ß√µes de gra√ßa, os baus podem ser dropados de hora em hora e no maximo dois por dia.

review: Really brings back memories from AOE, but playing AOE I never fully understood it at my younger ages. This game really simplifies everything to be easily understood. Some may disagree with the art style, but I personally enjoy it. Looking forward to future additions and improvments, my only suggestion to the devs is give people a reason to stick around and binge-play your game. Would also recommend looking to Starcraft and Warcraft for alternate insperation, make your game a better alternitive for all mainstream RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005109471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1544554856}
review:
Nothing you cannot find in an AOE 2. Feels a lot more like AOE 3 when it comes to building resistence (they go down very fast to any standard sized army and defensive buildings offer only minor damage/defence potential). 
Adds a few convenience features (e.g. queuing technologies) while dropping others (e.g. shift to add multiple units to the queue). Formations are a joke. Fighting looks and feels booring. Heros dont do much.
I've been told that I'm too much of an AOE fanboy to be objective here, but I think if you blatantly copy something you get compared to the original product.

Forcing me to buy additional civs and dropping lootboxes with cosmetic items... srsly? In a time where everybody shits on lootboxes and microtransactions, THIS is what you came up with to save your mediocre AOE knockoff? Have my slowclap....

Art style is nice and could work in a proper game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085363102', 'num_games_owned': 1004, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1544471634}
review: I played the tutorial and everything seemed to be going well. I played one game vs ai on a huge map and everything broke the frame rate was terrible so i dropped everything down to awful and it still wouldnt play. I play games like battlefield 1 on my pc and with very few problems at that. My comparisson is i can play age of empires 2 on the biggest maps with max ai and its seamless. Im a bit dissapointed really as this has got some functions I actually enjoy like auto-seed farms, seperate economy and military trees which mixes the game. Im not going to say its a terrible game as its not it just didnt work first time for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043997978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1555786004}
review: Este es un muy buen juego, y algunos diran qu es malo teniendo los age of empires, a esto voy a responder que, a mi tambien me gusta age of empirres en toda su saga pero pecan de que las facciones son en algunos casos un copy paste y algun cambio peque√±o y en otros ya son facciones mas distintas pero continuan siendo en bastantes aspectos iguales. Lo que hace distinto a Empires Apart es que todas las facciones son totalmente distintas entre ellas, tanto en unidades y mecanicas lo cual es lo que se llevaba a√±os pidiendo. Algunos diran que tiene pocas facciones, pues esto es debido a que al ser todas distintas entre ellas son mas dificiles y lleva mas tiempo hacerlas, y el juego hemos de recordar que ira teniendo mas facciones. Si bien el tema de que antes el juego fuera de pago y ahora los bizantinos sean gratuitos y el resto de pago, esto no lo hemso de ver como algo malo, pues el dinero que se invirtio originalmente no se a perdido ya que se ha repartido en lo que cuestan las civilizaciones y si ya tenias el juego ya tienes las civilizaciones, y el juego al tener ahora una faccion gratuita, lo que se ha conseguido es atraer mas personas y el multijugador esta ahora mas lleno.

review:
Das Spiel macht wirklich verdammt viel Spa√ü, wenn man es mit Freunden spielt - jedoch w√ºrde ich jedem dazu raten sich AoE2HD zu kaufen und eher die Finger von den "Civilization Packs" und den Lootcrates zu lassen, da dieser meiner Meinung nach √ºberteuert sind und nicht wirklich etwas bringen (selbst im Sale‚Ä¶).

Jedoch w√ºrde ich es an sich jeden empfehlen der was f√ºr zwischen durch mit seinen Kollegen braucht.

Man muss aber auch erw√§hnen das es sehr oft zu Verbindungsproblemen bzw. Synchronisation Problemen kommt und dies oft auch zu gamecrashes oder sehr lang anhaltenden Ladesequenzen f√ºhrt und somit sehr den Spielspa√ü einschr√§nken kann.

[b]F√ºr diejenigen die pro und contra Listen m√∂gen:[/b]

[h1][b]Pro:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*] macht verdammt viel Spa√ü mit Freunden
[*] guter Zeit vertreib
[*] Free 2 Play
[/list]

[h1][b]Contra:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*] Free 2 Play
[*] Lootcrates
[*] bis auf eine Zivilisation sind alle weiteren an "DLC" gebunden
[*] viele Server Probleme
[*] viele Synchronisationsprobleme
[/list]



TL:DR - 7/10, kann man aufjedenfall mal probieren :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080723695', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1572241443}
review:
What can I say... Empires Apart is one of the single best free-to-play games on Steam right now, and it's making me feel nostalgic. 

[h1]What's the gameplay like?[/h1]
The gameplay is strikingly similar to Age of Empires, with almost all of the elements seeming like they‚Äôve taken heavy inspiration from the series, even down to the ability to move your sheep. I loved Age of Empires, so I love the gameplay here, too. The mechanics are smooth, the UI is easy to navigate and simple, movement works well (for the most part, sometimes moving between and around walls can be‚Ä¶ interesting), and building is simple.

There are seven empires, with all but one, Byzantine, being DLC (more info below).

Playable Empires:
Byzantine Civilization (Base Game)
Arab Civilization (DLC)
Aztec Civilization (DLC)
Chinese Civilization (DLC)
French Civilization (DLC)
Korean Civilization (DLC)
Mongol Civilization (DLC)

[h1]And what about the graphics?[/h1]
The graphics are amazing. I was genuinely blown away at the art style and how almost flawless the graphic design is. Animations are smooth, the scenery is great, there's a wide variety of maps and sizes for greater graphical variation and much more than I could simply list here. Overall, the graphics are top-notch.

[h1]How do the developers earn money?[/h1]
Like any self-respecting F2P these days, Empires Apart earns its cash money from microtransactions. There's no paywall as such, and the game still plays great without any of the DLC, but if you want to unlock any other empire (except for the starting empire, Byzantine), you'll have to cough up for it. Usually, each "Civilization Pack" is A$7.50.

[h1]Should I install it?[/h1]
Yes. Realistically, what do you have to lose? If you're into RTS games or want to feel nostalgic over Age of Empires without paying for the remastered versions, this is definitely worth it. Having said that, if you're not into strategy, this probably isn't for you, though the stellar graphics may be enough to swindle you. 

[h1]Should I buy the DLC?[/h1]
It depends. I haven't bought any, but that's because I'm cheap. All of the DLC usually costs A$7.50, with 7 pieces of DLC in total. The DLC is largely cosmetic, with units and buildings varying based on the empire, but in a game where the art style is so impeccable, that‚Äôs just about enough to sell me. On top of this, the DLC includes special challenges, game mechanics and heroes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192616357', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1669184771}
review:
Amazing, fresh. My imagination feels completely immursed in the beautiful worlds you rule. Yes similar to Age of Empires but when you're actually playing you have a comepletely new vibe to it. It's fluid and intuative. I adore almost everything about it so far. It presents itself amazingly and I honestly think it's extremely underrated. Strongly reccomended for anyone with a vivid  historic or dominant imagination. 

I could play this game for hours thinking only 10 minutes have gone by

author: {'steamid': '76561198009805819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1542385239}
review:
Optimization is terrible. I have to run it with medium graphics which look like very low, in a game with cartoonish graphics whose high graphics already look like usual medium graphics. How is it possible that I run Age of Empires Online with much better graphics perfectly but I cant run this? I had to quite because the game with medium graphics is unplayable. You can't even make out the different units. 

Sort that out and I might give it another chance and recommend this gaame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054249887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1542561593}
review:
Finalmente un gioco che [b]vale la pena recensire e giocare[/b]. 
Dunque, per quelli come me, figli dei giochi di strategia visti dall'alto con innumerevoli task da compiere, radere al suolo foreste e avversari, gestire risorse ecc ecc, questo gioco vale la pena provarlo. 
[b]Ottime potenzialit√† e prestazioni elevate[/b]. 
Grafica minimal leggermente poligonale (altrimenti non sarebbe Indie) che non mi dispiace affatto.
Gestione fattorie non automatico e leggermente fastidioso in game dover riavviare la "Semina" per riprodurre il grano per i propri cittadini. 
[b]Ottimo[/b] punto a favore √® il Peso sul pc, veramente leggero e facile da downlodare.
Possibilit√† di giocare online o in singolo o addirittura insieme agli amici. 
Ottimo lavoro ragazzi, continuate cos√¨.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104112999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1710719380}
review:
This isn't a bad game but I would go for other RTS..
This game is a clone of Age of Empires II but "simplified". There are a lot of issues with the game such as your allies not doing anything in skirmish mode and the development system is not clear. 

The graphics reminded me of the late age of empires online (RIP) but still I honestly don't like this style due to its blocky models. 

It has a free to play mode so try it out for yourself. I would play AoE over this tbh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173434077', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1565660150}
review:
Lots of Fun, brings AOE2 to a more stable and usable version. Multiplayer works flawlessly, single player is fun but the AI needs work. You pay per nation you want which is an amazing idea, you won't be spending money on a faction you never play and you can try them all out before buying them. Played the AOE games and other games such as RON nonstop when I was younger with my sister and dad, this game let's us do that again while AOE2 is very hard to set up a multiplayer game when not on a local network. 

You may not want to get this game if:
-Low-Poly graphics put you off
-You are a die hard fan of the originals so much that you hate anyone attempting to replace them.
-Having a WIP game puts you off (yes there are bugs, no I haven't experienced any)
-Thats all I can think of

You may take this review as incredibly biased somehow but this is 100% my opinion, yours may differ, that's cool.

review: I played this a lot before it went free to play. then i left because the game had way too many problems. bad pathing technical problems desynchs and balance was terrible. now you would think the devs would fix all these things before they do a big step to f2p you know like to get a second chance. sad thing that has not happened. its as bad as before if not worse. I follow the discord a little now and then and the devs just dont seem to care and ignore all the feedback of the players to force through their own agenda.

review: La verdad esque tenia mono de jugar al aoe2 y este me entretiene bastante en 1vs1 y sin tener que pagar nada, tengo el aoe2 hd desde que salio, pero meda infinita pereza jugar por no tener matchmaking para 1vs1 cosa que este tiene. He leido rese√±as por ah√≠ que dicen que si lag que si tal, pero en 1vs1 el juego va super fluido, las mec√°nicas son de rts con gestion de recursos y ambientaci√≥n medieval. Una l√°stima que creo que al juego juegan pocas personas, pero la verdad que merece mucho la pena, adem√°s es  bastante m√°s rapido a la hora de la accion que el aoe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136955190', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1541326312}
review:
Nice game,
-if you like strategy games this is a very good version of reallity
-I LOVE THE GRAPHICS. The soldiers, the buildings, the terren. Everything is perfect
-Easy, funny
-You build your own base
But
-I dont like the combat. I mean if you want to destroy 1 house or a small base, you must have atleast 7 soldiers for 1 building. If you play on hardcore mode, late game you will need a whole army of 200 soldiers just to make a small damage.
-if you are with a nation everything will be in their language, so you actually have to make some changes in settings *if there are settings for this*
---->These are just, some details, the game is fine and its working good for every kind of computers (you dont need a super alien pc)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060450848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1541235876}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020200990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1541184954}
review:
Da veterano e appassionato degli RTS (come ad esempio Warcraft, Starcraft, Age of Empires, Dawn of war, Planetary annihilation, etc.) devo dire che dopo 1 ora questo gioco mi ha gi√† stancato.

PRO
grafica moderna (sebbene sia uno stile che non a tutti piace)
ispirazione ad Age of Empires

CONTRO
colonna sonora banale
alcuni suoni sono inappropriati e fastidiosi (come il suono delle frecce o quello di ricerca completata)
movimento delle unit√† scoordinato e confuso
colori annacquati (sembra tutto rosino)
ottimizzazione pessima (su un portatile con i7 e gtx850m fa fatica mettendo tutto al massimo)
le animazioni delle unit√† sono grezze
effetto sfocatura fastidioso
1 sola civilt√† nel free to play ... 

il risultato √® un gioco anonimo che sembra pi√π una serie di linee di codice copiate piuttosto che un'esperienza coinvolgente. Non riesco a capire cosa ci hanno messo di loro gli sviluppatori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274439286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3513, 'last_played': 1635721217}
review:
Very good game. Each civ is very unique and well designed. The game is fast paced, feels smooth and responsive.

Multiplayer runs smoothly, but needs a larger player base. Singleplayer has skirmish against an AI, which can scale up to quite a challenging difficulty and fun to play. There are also some cute little challenges to get to know a civs special features and practise unit micro too.

With the new F2P model it's definitely worth checking out; you get full access to basically the 'jack of all trades' civ, giving an excellent demo for how the game plays.

You can also check out individual civs to get an idea if you want to purchase them, either by playing against them in skirmish or online, or playing as them in demo missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1539945878}
review:
Went f2p and left previous players with 1 race, made all others paid DLC. Very poor imitation of Age Of Empires type games. Very medicore grqphics, badly executed controls, and riddled, and I mean riddled with bugs and sloppy code, netcode especially. There are so many games of this genre that, even not free, are very low priced and well made. Even free this is a horrible deriviative knock-off.

As to the developer, a control freak that censors the forum and bans anyone critizing the descisions. Yes includiing me, didn't attack, didn't curse, didn't fight, just gave opinion on a game switiching to f2p as not a good idea when reviews are already bad...boom, permanate ban. (Screenshot available).  There are other developers who deserve your money and time. Don't reward such behavior with DLC purchases when there are so many other, easy to find, better options for your gaming time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168794115', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1546216694}
review:
Empires Apart es un RTS cl√°sico al mejor estilo AOE2, pero a diferencia del AOE2 cada civilizaci√≥n se siente realmente diferente a las otras. Algunas cosas pueden mejorarse -como el rendimiento en algunos casos y la IA, especialmente la de los mongoles-, pero los parches suelen venir a intervalos regulares. Estoy completamente enamorado del estilo de juego de los Aztecas y a la espera de ver qu√© nuevas civilizaciones y cambios le depara el futuro (se habla mucho de los vikingos  e ingleses, aunque espero ver m√°s civs no europeas como incas o jemeres). En resumen, un juego muy divertido y recomendado para aquellos que nos gusta el g√©nero RTS y preferimos jugar m√°s de un s√≥lo juego del g√©nero.
El √∫nico aspecto flojo que he encontrado es la traducci√≥n en espa√±ol, que no est√° del todo completa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116459239', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1540836745}
review: Looks great for a low poly style RTS but... When i played my first ranked game and played against someone who knew the game very well and as my first match in ranked i did not play against an beginner as myself. So i played 3 more matches and got always matched up against players that know the mechanics in the game... The matchmaking system is so bad and broken. At 15 minutes i completed 2 technologys, had a small army and i thought "Oh this is pretty good." but nope the enemy had an army of 30 soldiers with artillery and every other soldier in the freaking game. And this happend not only in my first match but every freaking ranked match i play...
developer_response: Sorry you are having problems. We recommend you play a few skirmish games before trying multiplayer. If you've only played 2 hours you probably haven't grasped the basics yet and a bit more single player practice would be great before you go online. Even new players who have played a few skirmishes are going to give you a beating if you go online without any experience. The system matches you against someone with your rank. If you're new, you'll get the same rank as someone playing their first MP game after 10 skirmish battles. I don't know how you solve that problem. It also depends how many players of your rank are online at the time. Please give single player a bit more time and try again and I think you'll enjoy it, or go to the Discord channel and ask for some help from other players who will train you up!

review:
Gioco molto bello e ben fatto, con una grafica minimal e semplice ma molto affascinante. 

Ci sono molti aspetti (soprattutto bug) da rivedere con qualche patch, come ad esempio le unit√† e i cittadini che non riescono a raggiungere un posto X se devono passare dai cancelli aperti. Per il resto trovo scomodo il fatto che si pu√≤ muovere la mappa solo con le frecce e non con i tasti WASD (questa scelta andava bene nel 2008, non nel 2018).
developer_response: Giusto per conoscenza, puoi muovere la mappa anche portando il mouse sui bordi, o col tasto centrale del mouse (oltre ovviamente a cliccare sulla minimappa)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018586372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1865, 'last_played': 1540774371}
review:
Well a very good RTS game. Its f2p so anyone can taste the gameplay before they decide to support the game and buy some other Civ. Byzantines are good balanced so anyone who start shouldnt think that other civs are OP. Every Civs has theirs +/-

I dont understand why many cry that they only get 1 civ in a f2p game with no p2w.
So yeah they need to earn their money to make the game better and to live, so they sell dlc/skins in this case Civs.
And 4 Euro per Civ is pretty cheap.

AoE I-III 
many say that its an AoE clone, but rly.
just cause its the same Art of RTS Game doesnt it mean thats its a clone and well Empires Apart is much better than AoE

The Cartoonish look is not for you, but you like RTS games and thinks too that AoE looks crap 
Then try 0 a.d

author: {'steamid': '76561198307219582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1611806207}
review:
el juego es un dicipulo de AOE 2 en el cual cada faccion jugable es un dlc a un precio rasonable a escepcion de los bizantinos que vienen con el juego 

de momento esta repleto de bugs o fallos los cuales joden bastante como los sgts:
-el juego se cierra solo.
-cuando juegas contra la IA en ocasiones esta no mueve en toda la partida. por lo tanto no hace nada mas que esperar su muerte.
-en partidas de 4 vs 4 los fps colapsan si tienes un pc de requisitos minimos.
-los carros del mercado se atascan de forma exagerada

todo esto seguramente lo arreglen pero de momento este juego no es recomendable segun mi opinion

review:
‚ÄúDarmowa, przyjemna gra, czerpiƒÖca z istniejƒÖcego schematu oraz majƒÖca swoje wkurzajƒÖce b≈Çƒôdy.‚Äù

Trylogia Age of Empires to seria gier, kt√≥re zdecydowanie mog≈Çyby opisaƒá moje wra≈ºenia z Empires Apart. M√≥wiƒÖc szczerze to bardzo widocznie ta gra siƒô nimi inspirowa≈Ça, ale troszeczkƒô co≈õ przy tym nie pyk≈Ço i zosta≈Ç dodany z≈Çy sk≈Çadnik ‚Äì b≈Çƒôdy i zabrak≈Ço jednego ‚Äì wsparcia dla modyfikacji, albo jakiegokolwiek edytora map. Jako, ≈ºe gra przesz≈Ça niedawno na model F2P postanowi≈Çem pobraƒá i przekonaƒá siƒô, czy jest warta uwagi. 

Uwaga! Jeszcze zanim przystƒÖpimy do poczƒÖtku tej ≈ºadnej recenzji, pragnƒô wspomnieƒá, ≈ºe oceniam tutaj wy≈ÇƒÖcznie wersjƒô darmowƒÖ (bez ≈ºadnych dodatk√≥w), a te dodajƒÖ nowe frakcje z prawdopodobnie nowymi elementami. Dlatego nie jestem w stanie w pe≈Çni oceniƒá gry.

Ale zacznijmy od poczƒÖtku, rozpocznijmy od czego≈õ co widzimy w pierwszym momencie od w≈ÇƒÖczenia gry ‚Äì Interfejs. Uwa≈ºam, ≈ºe jest zrobiony stosunkowo dobrze, jak na wyglƒÖd wsp√≥≈Çczesnego typowego UI. Stosuje przezroczysto≈õƒá, minimalizm oraz specyficznƒÖ czcionkƒô. 

To na co nale≈ºy zwr√≥ciƒá uwagƒô po prawdziwym w≈ÇƒÖczeniu gry, to ≈õwietna grafika - zas≈Çuga silnika Unreal Engine 4. Efekt zniszczenia r√≥wnie≈º na wielki plus. Mo≈ºe dlatego takie du≈ºe wymagania graficzne? Ale na powa≈ºnie, przecie≈º to sƒÖ wymagania WIƒòKSZE od GTA 5. Ma≈Çe por√≥wnanie:

Ciekawe‚Ä¶

W ka≈ºdym razie m√≥j komputer nie dosta≈Ç wielkiej zadyszki podczas grania i nie dymi≈Ço siƒô z niego (prawdopodobnie - nie wiem, by≈Çem zajƒôty graniem [ech, te strategie :>]).

Rozgrywka jak wspomnia≈Çem wcze≈õniej, przypomina Age of Empires, zw≈Çaszcza drugƒÖ czƒô≈õƒá trylogii. Wed≈Çug mnie, obie gry r√≥≈ºniƒÖ siƒô tylko rozwijaniem epok, poniewa≈º w Empires Apart jest podzia≈Ç na rozw√≥j ekonomiczny i militarny. Mo≈ºemy ulepszyƒá ka≈ºdy z nich dwa razy (podobnie jak cztery epoki w AOE II). Niestety zosta≈Ço "wywalone" ulepszanie niekt√≥rych rzeczy, np. Szybsze poruszanie statk√≥w.

üéµ Muzyka - nijaka, niczym siƒô nie wyr√≥≈ºniajƒÖca. Wg. mnie dobry by≈Çby system programalnej muzyki, kt√≥ra zmienia sw√≥j loop, w trakcie jakie≈õ interakcji miƒôdzy graczem.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

7/10 

Mi≈Ço spƒôdzi≈Çem czas wraz ze znajomymi, niekiedy oczekujƒÖc lub tworzƒÖc co chwila nowy serwer, bo na tamtym wyskoczy≈Ça desynchronizacja, lub komu≈õ scrashowa≈Ça gra (tak, ten tytu≈Ç lubi czƒôsto wywalaƒá Fatal Error'em). Gdyby nie te b≈Çƒôdy, wystawi≈Çbym ocenƒô 8/10. A po dodaniu takiej samej zawarto≈õci jaka jest w AOE II, by≈Çbym sk≈Çonny daƒá 9.5/10 (10 to chyba za du≈ºo).

author: {'steamid': '76561198067435662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1569009875}
review:
I highly recommended this game!
Yeah, most of people here says that its a bad copy of  AoE 2... but i dont think thats true.
Empires Apart give us something fresh - a new vision of already proven RTS and lot of new stuff like
- other Nations (Byzantine, Mongol, Aztec and the new one Korean) 
- more various game modes (Assasination, Diplomacy etc.)
- different heroes with many special abilities
- cool new vision of the terrain

I emphasize that the game is currently very raw! I hope they will add more units and nations + fix some bugs, like the biggest in my opinion - The AI ‚Äã‚Äãdon't really attacks me, they start sending me some units around 10-15 min but it's nothing... (Difficulty: Medium/Hard)

So I am very hopeful in the future development of the game!
